Those flowers are no longer extant, but the Padisarah is a cultivar that was brought back to the land via the use of the Anahitian Blessing.

Name: Rukkhashava Mushrooms
Desc:
A fungus that grows in layers upon layers, like a sea of clouds, which mostly grows on trees deep in the rainforest and is considered by the people of Sumeru to be a symbol of the gods' grace.
Legend has it that in ancient times, there was once a towering giant tree with its crown covering the entire Sumeru. People addressed it as Rukkhadevata and believed the Fungi scattered throughout the rainforest were the holy crystallization of its legacy. In Sumeru, those who dwell in the forest have a tradition of offering Rukkhashava Mushrooms to the Akademiya, but no one knows what these offerings are meant to be used for.
Src: Recommendation: Found in the Ashavan Realm

Name: Starshroom
Desc: A fungus with a cap that resembles a five-pointed star. It is quite hardy indeed. Once it matures, the center of the cap will split open.

Name: Lavender Melon
Desc:
A fruit with gorgeous skin. The flesh within transforms into food with a unique mouthfeel when cooked.
In Inazuma, there is a traditional art that involves using the outer skins of these fruits to make dye. They say that Konda Village once planted Lavender Melons and that they were famed for their secret "Konda Dye" art, by which they produced truly lovely fabric.
Src: Found in the wild in Inazuma

Name: Seagrass
Desc: A plant that grows in shallow seas. It adds a unique flavor to dishes.

Name: Fluorescent Fungus
Desc: A mushroom that glows like a night-light. Some curious power lies hidden within it. Amidst the fog that blankets Tsurumi Island, these Fluorescent Fungi can help to light the way.

Name: Amakumo Fruit
Desc:
The fruit of the Amakumo Grass, which grows on Seirai Island. You can hear it crackling with a tiny current if you hold it up to your ear.
The Amakumo Grass was born when the terrible slaughter that tore through Seirai Island, causing it to ever be under a stormy shroud, ended. As if showing its defiance, it will bear fruit while facing the peals of thunder from the sky.
This bold spirit also accompanied those who emigrated to Seirai Island, until Koseki Village was at last ruined and no clergy-person was left to man the Asase Shrine.

Name: Sango Pearl
Desc:
These pearls only grow alongside the coral of Watatsumi, and they will emit a cooling sensation in your palm as gentle as a moonbeam.
Some local stories say that if held by a person in whose veins runs the blood of Watatsumi, these pearls will become brighter still, for these pearls are the blood that Watatsumi Omikami shed for its people. Other legends say that the great Omikami used a pearl as bright as the moon to shine upon Enkanomiya, leading the people who dwelt there up to the surface. As such, the Sango Pearls are akin to sacred relics to some.
The "pearls and waves" of the Sangonomiya emblem are said to come from these very waves that embraced Watatsumi and the bright gem that gave it light.

Name: Sea Ganoderma
Desc:
A plant species that only grows in certain regions and islands of the ocean. Though it looks like a fungus of some sort, it actually comes from a substance secreted by certain soft-bodied organisms.
In the folktales told in a certain land, these mouthless, noseless creatures are the transformed souls of children who died young. As a form of punishment, they must spend endless years absorbing the elements within the sand and sea using their fragile bodies, piling them up and forming "Sea Ganoderma." And once the Ganoderma are fully formed, they shall be harvested.

Name: Naku Weed
Desc:
Even on windless days, this plant will tremble lightly amid the cries of thunder. The parts of it that resemble petals are in fact extensions of the leaves meant to protect the fragile flower.
The Naku Weed grows strongly in areas saturated with Electro energy. Due to its great affinity for lightning, it is often used by residents to predict storms. Stories tell that these plants are what the bake-danuki Ioroi stole from the Shogun's very own garden using its powers, before planting them throughout the islands. Even long after its punishment and disappearance, people still speak of Ioroi's many deeds.

Name: Dendrobium
Desc:
A vibrant plant that has also been named "lycoris" by the poets. It was once thought extinct in the Inazuman archipelago, only to re-emerge now upon the battlefields. It is said that it blooms most enchantingly where much blood was spilled.
Though it is very rare and expensive, this plant is regarded as ominous, and thus is little purchased. Rumor has it that these plants are watered using blood. The bloodier and more brutal the battlefield, the more lovely the dendrobium blooms shall be. Inazumans believe that the souls of the fallen shall follow the winding paths of the bloodied dendrobiums into the next life, thus rejoining the eternal elemental cycle. But as for those who doubt or are perplexed by "eternity," they shall be shackled to the earth, becoming another enchantingly red flower amid the vermillion fields.

Name: Crystal Marrow
Desc:
A crystal that contains a sliver of Tatarigami power. Adding this material during smelting will greatly increase the strength and toughness of metals.
In Inazuma, "Tatarigami" refers to the corpse of a divine being and the strange phenomena it creates. They say that before the god that created Crystal Marrow became the Tatarigami, it had many names, one of which was "Orobashi no Mikoto." Orobashi no Mikoto's body was as long as the winding seashore, and its voice was so resounding that only the Dark Sea could absorb it. Yet in the end, it too was cut down together with Yashiori Island itself.

Name: Sakura Bloom
Desc:
A petal that has fallen from the Grand Narukami Shrine's Sacred Sakura. They float in mid-air due to the effect of Electro energies.
Legend holds that the roots of Thunder Sakura are linked deep beneath the earth. Should you trace these roots, you will always come back to this sacred sakura tree that stands guard over Inazuma. Some other legends have it that the Thunder Sakura are part of the Almighty Narukami Ogosho, the result of her splitting her divine form into parts, all the better to defend those under her rule with.

Name: Onikabuto
Desc:
A strange beetle that inhabits areas rich with Electro energy. Its docile and sedentary temperament could not be more different from the fierce, demonic visage displayed on its armored shell.
Inazuman folktales say that when the gods were apportioning territory to the many animals, the onikabuto, who detested conflict, chose first to live in lands saturated in Electro. As many years passed, it evolved bizarre patterns with which to frighten trespassers and developed horns that could release electricity to deter predators. Yet though it wears armor and bears horns, the onikabuto hates fighting most of all animals.

Name: Borderland Polearm Billet
Desc:
Weapon forging material. Can be used to forge 4-star polearms.
In terms of the "state" of the many weapons that can be crafted from billets, while their potential has long been contained within the original materials, the exact forms these weapons will ultimately take remain unknown to this day...

Name: Borderland Catalyst Billet
Desc:
Weapon forging material. Can be used to forge 4-star catalysts.
In terms of the "state" of the many weapons that can be crafted from billets, while their potential has long been contained within the original materials, the exact forms these weapons will ultimately take remain unknown to this day...

Name: Borderland Claymore Billet
Desc:
Weapon forging material. Can be used to forge 4-star claymores.
In terms of the "state" of the many weapons that can be crafted from billets, while their potential has long been contained within the original materials, the exact forms these weapons will ultimately take remain unknown to this day...

Name: Borderland Bow Billet
Desc:
Weapon forging material. Can be used to forge 4-star bows.
In terms of the "state" of the many weapons that can be crafted from billets, while their potential has long been contained within the original materials, the exact forms these weapons will ultimately take remain unknown to this day...

Name: Borderland Sword Billet
Desc:
Weapon forging material. Can be used to forge 4-star swords.
In terms of the "state" of the many weapons that can be crafted from billets, while their potential has long been contained within the original materials, the exact forms these weapons will ultimately take remain unknown to this day...

Name: Midlander Polearm Billet
Desc:
Weapon forging material. Can be used to forge 4-star polearms.
Philosophers believe that there are four purposes behind earthly things. The purpose of these billets is to become a weapon worthy of accompanying a hero.
Src: Sumeru and Fontaine Trounce Domain Challenge Reward

Name: Midlander Catalyst Billet
Desc:
Weapon forging material. Can be used to forge 4-star catalysts.
Philosophers believe that there are four purposes behind earthly things. The purpose of these billets is to become a weapon worthy of accompanying a hero.
Src: Sumeru and Fontaine Trounce Domain Challenge Reward

Name: Midlander Claymore Billet
Desc:
Weapon forging material. Can be used to forge 4-star claymores.
Philosophers believe that there are four purposes behind earthly things. The purpose of these billets is to become a weapon worthy of accompanying a hero.
Src: Sumeru and Fontaine Trounce Domain Challenge Reward

Name: Midlander Bow Billet
Desc:
Weapon forging material. Can be used to forge 4-star bows.
Philosophers believe that there are four purposes behind earthly things. The purpose of these billets is to become a weapon worthy of accompanying a hero.
Src: Sumeru and Fontaine Trounce Domain Challenge Reward

Name: Midlander Sword Billet
Desc:
Weapon forging material. Can be used to forge 4-star swords.
Philosophers believe that there are four purposes behind earthly things. The purpose of these billets is to become a weapon worthy of accompanying a hero.
Src: Sumeru and Fontaine Trounce Domain Challenge Reward

Name: Northlander Polearm Billet
Desc:
Weapon forging material. Can be used to forge 4-star polearms.
Philosophers believe marble has the potential to be sculpted into a beautiful statue. Likewise, these billets have the potential to become something greater.
Src: Reward for completing Trounce Domain Challenge in Mondstadt, Liyue, or Inazuma, or the Dominator of Wolves Challenge

Name: Northlander Catalyst Billet
Desc:
Weapon forging material. Can be used to forge 4-star catalysts.
Philosophers believe marble has the potential to be sculpted into a beautiful statue. Likewise, these billets have the potential to become something greater.
Src: Reward for completing Trounce Domain Challenge in Mondstadt, Liyue, or Inazuma, or the Dominator of Wolves Challenge

Name: Northlander Claymore Billet
Desc:
Weapon forging material. Can be used to forge 4-star claymores.
Philosophers believe marble has the potential to be sculpted into a beautiful statue. Likewise, these billets have the potential to become something greater.
Src: Reward for completing Trounce Domain Challenge in Mondstadt, Liyue, or Inazuma, or the Dominator of Wolves Challenge

Name: Northlander Bow Billet
Desc:
Weapon forging material. Can be used to forge 4-star bows.
Philosophers believe marble has the potential to be sculpted into a beautiful statue. Likewise, these billets have the potential to become something greater.
Src: Reward for completing Trounce Domain Challenge in Mondstadt, Liyue, or Inazuma, or the Dominator of Wolves Challenge

Name: Northlander Sword Billet
Desc:
Weapon forging material. Can be used to forge 4-star swords.
Philosophers believe marble has the potential to be sculpted into a beautiful statue. Likewise, these billets have the potential to become something greater.
Src: Reward for completing Trounce Domain Challenge in Mondstadt, Liyue, or Inazuma, or the Dominator of Wolves Challenge

Name: Condessence Crystal
Desc:
A bright and clear crystal, the core is both tough and malleable.
According to ancient legend, this resplendent crystal was a gift bestowed by envoys of the heavens. The shimmering light reflected day and night is a symbol of the white moon's favor, giving humanity the authority to forge wondrous objects. Such legends have long been impossible to verify, but modern artisans still use this kind of bright yet strong crystal to create all kinds of accessories and weapons.

Name: Amethyst Lump
Desc: An uncut crystal that can only be found in Inazuma. Some professional craftsmanship will bring out its true value.

Name: Starsilver
Desc: A rare and precious ore formed by the unique geographical conditions and Ley Lines of Dragonspine.

Name: Magical Crystal Chunk
Desc:
These crystal chunks can be refined into Weapon EXP materials by using Original Resin.
Crystals from mines that were eroded by the energy of the Ley Lines cannot be processed by ordinary means.

Name: Crystal Chunk
Desc: An uncut crystal. Only professional craftsmanship can bring out its true value. This kind of limpid rock is a precious gift of the land, which can be utilized as a valuable weapon-making material.

Name: White Iron Chunk
Desc: This white iron ore can be turned into a variety of splendid items in the hands of a skilled craftsman. It is suffused with memories of battles fought across the land, which makes it a great material for crafting weapons.

Name: Iron Chunk
Desc: This iron ore can be turned into a multitude of handy items in the hands of a skilled craftsman. Mineral ores' presence on the surface usually indicates abundant ore veins underneath.

Name: Travel Notes: Speculation
Desc:
Namecard style.
Should chess pieces ever grow minds of their own, could they too force their players into awkward zugzwang?

Name: Celebration: Lavish Gala
Desc:
Namecard style.
Amid the ticking countdown, the gala commences on schedule. After their masked waltz, the two set their separate schemes into motion...
Perhaps this unspoken understanding is the true "treasure" to be cherished.
Src: Reward from the "Genshin Impact × KFC" collaboration

Name: Dahlia: Sacred Duty
Desc:
Namecard style.
If the essence of being an "idol" is simply "being loved," then Dahlia might've found his sacred calling. Barbara still strives to perfect her image, while Dahlia need only guard his privacy — lest someone spot him sharing drinks with a certain bard...
...Though that may not be as easy as it seems.
Src: Reward for reaching Friendship 10 with Dahlia

Name: Skirk: Lone Shadow
Desc:
Namecard style.
Her solitude is not some show meant to maintain an air of mystery. She was once the last rabbit left standing in the wildfire's wake — now, she's a lion in disguise, unable to speak her truth to the sheep.
Src: Reward for reaching Friendship 10 with Skirk

Name: Travel Notes: Balletica
Desc:
Namecard style.
Script supervisors perform a vital role. They record every detail of each scene to ensure continuity. Thinking about it, you're the best script supervisor there is — you already remember everything.

Name: Ifa: Bro
Desc:
Namecard style.
"'Is there any point in getting close to Ifa?' Of course there is, bro, absolutely." "Of course there is, bro, of course there is."
Src: Reward for reaching Friendship 10 with Ifa

Name: Escoffier: Charm
Desc:
Namecard style.
For Escoffier, a certain relationship exists between rhythm and flavor. Why, then, does she not fuel her compositions with delicious food? The answer is quite simple — consistent flavors are reliable and comforting, but no one wants to hear the same song over and over.
Src: Reward for reaching Friendship 10 with Escoffier

Name: Travel Notes: Blooming Glory
Desc:
Namecard style.
We learn to fight through play and pursuit, to stand firm through wounds and hardship, and with that strength, set forth for the very limits of the world.

Name: Achievement: Tranquil Peace
Desc:
Namecard style.
If ever the day comes when all worldly conflicts can finally be put to rest, then even the gods of night themselves may drift off into peaceful slumber.
Src: Reward for completing all achievements under "Duelist: Series III"

Name: Natlan: Draconic Gaze
Desc:
Namecard style.
Having once beheld the old world in all its glory, these draconic eyes now shine with fresh vigor, heralding the dawn of a new one.
Src: Reward for completing all achievements under "Sacred Mountain's Fading Glow."

Name: Iansan: Unyielding
Desc:
Namecard style.
"If you really need to, and you push yourself hard enough, you can even train in your dreams!" Sounds great, but... Is it actually possible?
Src: Reward for reaching Friendship 10 with Iansan

Name: Varesa: Powerhouse
Desc:
Namecard style.
What could possibly be the secret to her immense strength? D'you think it's got something to do with her nigh-on insatiable appetite...?
Src: Reward for reaching Friendship 10 with Varesa

Name: Travel Notes: Wondrous Reverie
Desc:
Namecard style.
As flowers bloom and distant songs fade, faint traces of dreams remain.

Name: Celebration: Scorch
Desc:
Namecard style.
The secret to unleashing a powerful attack is to pull back your fist and then strike out with unwavering conviction.
Src: Obtained from the "Realm of Tempered Valor" event

Name: Yumemizuki Mizuki: Nightmare Devourer
Desc:
Namecard style.
The yumekui-baku consume nightmares and leave only pleasant dreams. But what if dreams are to be understood in reverse? Faced with such conjecture, her warm-natured response: A truly beautiful dream, even if turned upside down through reality's lens, would still remain beautiful.
Src: Reward for reaching Friendship 10 with Yumemizuki Mizuki

Name: Travel Notes: The Flame Renewed
Desc:
Namecard style.
The spring comes on sure, and old peach wood charms must be burned. Raise your cups of herbal wine in toast, then exchange those old talismans for new ones.

Name: Achievement: Repertoire
Desc:
Namecard style.
Perhaps a melody may exist that collects and contains all the wondrous music in the world. Surging heartbeats mark the musical phrase, anxious thoughts form brief rests, and within the notes lie all things — laughter, tears, forgotten dreams, and dancing raindrops...
Src: Reward for completing all achievements under "Repertoire of Myriad Melodies"

Name: Achievement: Blaze
Desc:
Namecard style.
After the flame that once represented light, heat, and wisdom became corroded by the tenebrous dark, the only thing that yet belonged to the imprisoned titan was its inextinguishable will to fight.
Src: Reward for completing all achievements under "Challenger: Series X"

Name: Achievement: All-Seeing
Desc:
Namecard style.
The gaze of a traveler looks upon all like a light, and your impression of things will someday resurface in your mind in vivid, intense color.
Src: Reward for completing all achievements under "Mortal Travails: Series V"

Name: Lan Yan: Silver Swallow
Desc:
Namecard style.
The swallow's arrival shall bring forth cleansing rains, washing the worries of wizened winter away.
Src: Reward for reaching Friendship 10 with Lan Yan

Name: Citlali: Opalstar
Desc:
Namecard style.
The black one is akin to obsidian, and is thus called "Itzpapa." The white one is white as a star, and has thus been named "Citlalin."
Src: Reward for reaching Friendship 10 with Citlali

Name: Mavuika: Sun-Crowned
Desc:
Namecard style.
No Pyro Archon has ever intended to contest the sun. But as ordinary people see it, this "solar ring" is the crown of leaders as radiant as the sun.
Src: Reward for reaching Friendship 10 with Mavuika

Name: Travel Notes: Spiritweaver
Desc:
Namecard style.
The reason that the Masters of the Night-Wind are able to record stories in their scrolls is very simple — that everything in this world has its warp and weft. All that has been is no less than the very fabric of existence.

Name: Achievement: Fighting Spirit
Desc:
Namecard style.
Even if one was to lose their physical form and find themselves trapped in the cold depths of some ghostly spring, the will to fight on shall never fade away.
Src: Reward for completing all achievements under "Duelist: Series II"

Name: Natlan: Fleeting Dreams
Desc:
Namecard style.
Before one could become a sage among dragons, or a king among men, the ploys of one's ambition would have long since turned to naught but dreams. Yet to be incomplete is good; superior, in fact, to perfection.
Src: Reward for completing all achievements under "Natlan: The Land of Fire and Competition (II)"

Name: Ororon: Nightshade
Desc:
Namecard style.
Just as starlight cannot overpower the darkness of night, so too do shadows linger beneath the candle's light. Likewise, the heart's emptiness cannot easily be filled.
Src: Reward for reaching Friendship 10 with Ororon

Name: Chasca: Fully Loaded
Desc:
Namecard style.
Fear not, she's here to make peace, not to fight. The only question is whether to save a few bullets... Y'know, the type that get fired into the sky as warning shots.
Src: Reward for reaching Friendship 10 with Chasca

Name: Travel Notes: Sabzeruz
Desc:
Namecard style.
"Twelve moons and twelve more, new memories will grow."

Name: Xilonen: Cue Point
Desc:
Namecard style.
Right on cue, the mountains echo with the rhythm of Xilonen's forge-hammer. When the final echo fades, she has already long ceased her toil and found a sunlit spot for her afternoon nap.
Src: Reward for reaching Friendship 10 with Xilonen

Name: Celebration: Crispy and Sweet
Desc:
Namecard style.
This golden array of food is the perfect balance of salty and sweet.

Name: Travel Notes: Primal Fire
Desc:
Namecard style.
But why green, brown, and purple? Shouldn't the first companions we meet be red, green, and blue, or... yellow?

Name: Achievement: Lord of the Night
Desc:
Namecard style.
How can restless thoughts be calmed? In this land, the only way is battle!
Src: Reward for completing all achievements under "Duelist: Series I"

Name: Natlan: Return of the Flame
Desc:
Namecard style.
Give yourself over to the joy of the contest — for victor and vanquished shall earn honor in equal measure, with both belonging to the flames of the night.
Src: Reward for completing all achievements under "Natlan: The Land of Fire and Competition (I)"

Name: Achievement: Feline Fortune
Desc:
Namecard style.
You want to know what the future holds? Then stay here and sit tight. Let this little kitty resist the urge to knock the crystal ball onto the ground, and steal the secrets of fate for you.
Src: Reward for completing all achievements under "Imaginarium Theater: The Second Folio"

Name: Achievement: Endpoint
Desc:
Namecard style.
The orbits of the true stars are traced in myriad rings across the night sky. A sea of blossom awaits the return of a single flower, anticipating the day when both hearts and petals shall become soft and tender.
Src: Reward for completing all achievements under "Meetings in Outrealm: Series V"

Name: Natlan: Fiery Dragon
Desc:
Namecard style.
"...Sharer of light, heat, and wisdom, the dragon king awaits the coming visitor in silence beneath returning moonlight. His reawakening is not simply for..."
Src: Reward for reaching the highest Reputation Level with 4 tribes

Name: Natlan: Divine Army
Desc:
Namecard style.
"...Bathed by a hidden sun, Xbalanque's forces advance with unstoppable momentum. He brings all-out war to the world once more, but his goals don't stop there..."
Src: Reward for reaching the highest Reputation Level with 1 tribe

Name: Kachina: Twirly
Desc:
Namecard style.
The upper half of the Turbo Twirly is very stable, but if the lower half gets stuck, there's a high chance you'll end up with one very dizzy rider.
Src: Reward for reaching Friendship 10 with Kachina

Name: Mualani: Sharky
Desc:
Namecard style.
Sharks that live in the sea don't actually like eating people — they prefer marine creatures. So as a shark that lives in freshwater hot springs, it's only natural that Mualani's Sharky Surfboard will only eat hot spring creatures. ...Just kidding, those Capybaras can sleep easy. Firstly, because their meat's too tough. And secondly, because... it's a surfboard?
Src: Reward for reaching Friendship 10 with Mualani

Name: Kinich: Ajaw
Desc:
Namecard style.
At first glance, you might think that the Almighty Dragonlord, K'uhul Ajaw had finally succeeded in turning the puny Kinich into a vessel of his will. Sadly, though, this is just the way namecards are named.
Src: Reward for reaching Friendship 10 with Kinich

Name: Celebration: Feast (II)
Desc:
Namecard style.
What makes a feast? Tomatoes, onions, and all other delicious things.

Name: Travel Notes: Fanciful Fabrication
Desc:
Namecard style.
Wood is processed into paper, and paper is folded into trees. All who are of folded paper shelter a true self within a falsehood.

Name: Emilie: Base Note
Desc:
Namecard style.
"The top note is sweet, the middle rich but not distracting, and the base — Ah! Such a faint fragrance! Such an exquisite perfume."
Orders flow in and out in an endless stream, and to prevent any scents from disturbing her work, Emilie very seldom uses perfume herself. Alas. When will she have the chance to delight in those base notes?
Src: Reward for reaching Friendship 10 with Emilie

Name: Travel Notes: Simulnation
Desc:
Namecard style.
"Victory is but a mere trick of the player's imagination. Silence is the chessboard's true endgame. As such, the one virtuous deed is to play, and to forfeit is the sole sin." "Hey, why don't you play a few less wargames?"

Name: Achievement: Poetic Pages
Desc:
Namecard style.
The dreams someone weaves into being are false, but they nonetheless point toward something real. There must be an eternity forged from "memory" at the end of this path.
Src: Reward for completing all achievements under "Imaginarium Theater: The First Folio"

Name: Sethos: Ba Fragment
Desc:
Namecard style.
Each Ba Fragment has its unique symbol. While this one resembles an hourglass, it represents King Deshret's rule over both Upper and Lower Setekh. As for the light within, it stands for the wisdom of Hermanubis.
Src: Reward for reaching Friendship 10 with Sethos

Name: Sigewinne: Treatment
Desc:
Namecard style.
Sigewinne will take good care of her patients. Don't worry, her injections aren't that painful — and while the medicines aren't very tasty, you'd take them over the barren wasteland that special blend milkshakes represent.
Src: Reward for reaching Friendship 10 with Sigewinne

Name: Clorinde: Roleplay
Desc:
Namecard style.
Dedicated Game Masters at the Tabletop Troupe will sometimes switch hats to indicate their change in role. Hmm, in that case, does Clorinde—
Forget about it! She doesn't even take that hat off when swimming.
Src: Reward for reaching Friendship 10 with Clorinde

Name: Travel Notes: The Realms Rocked
Desc:
Namecard style.
"The world does not love its children. If not, why chase them into the next one?" "What do you know? Maybe that one rocks even harder."

Name: Fontaine: Lucine
Desc:
Namecard style.
Don't drink from the Fountain of Lucine. You never know whose tears you're swallowing.
Src: Reach Fountain of Lucine Favor Level 48

Name: Achievement: Whalewrangler
Desc:
Namecard style.
This time, Tartaglia fought this entity for a long time, though he remained unable to defeat it. Hunting the same whale thrice is considered unlucky, but he will not give up. That said, it will be a long while before the creature fully recovers.
Src: Reward for completing all achievements under "Challenger: Series IX"

Name: Fontaine: Attunement
Desc:
Namecard style.
The symphony known as "Phobos" has gone out of control, and a Harmost must bring it back in harmony. Yet Fortuna's wheels turn on noiselessly, for destiny knows that even the perfect melody must someday end.
Src: Reward for completing all achievements under "Rhapsodia in the Ancient Sea"

Name: Arlecchino: Edict
Desc:
Namecard style.
"Father" laid down the harsh strictures of the House of the Hearth, and some of these seem almost unreasonable. Those familiar with her can use these rules to trace the outline of the ideals she so rarely speaks of.
Src: Reward for reaching Friendship 10 with Arlecchino

Name: Travel Notes: Arcane Amassing
Desc:
Namecard style.
Alchemy is a discipline that studies the conversion from one substance to another, but using alchemy to make potions reduces the quality by a drop. I don't know, perhaps that missing drop is converted into making everyone's mood a bit lighter.

Name: Chiori: Spectacular Sleeves
Desc:
Namecard style.
The doll known as "Tamoto-chan" was one of Chiori's earliest works, and is also the model that requires the least fabric and tailoring.
Src: Reward for reaching Friendship Lv. 10 with Chiori

Name: Album: The Stellar Moments
Desc:
Namecard style.
We parted in one melody and reunited in another.

Name: Travel Notes: Vibrant Harriers
Desc:
Namecard style.
Harriers and cranes come early in spring. Let the wind rise and the kites soar.

Name: Chenyu: Rainjade Rite
Desc:
Namecard style.
Stars flicker brightly above the tranquil sea and rivers. The mountain folk dance in harmony with birds and beasts.
Src: Reward for reaching Rainjade Oblation Level 10.

Name: Achievement: Adeptal Valley
Desc:
Namecard style.
...After that, the fish sank to the bottom of the lake, and the snake was split into several pieces. The remaining beasts waited on mountains, rivers, and moon, awaiting their silent answer.
Src: Reward for completing all achievements under "Chenyu's Splendor."

Name: Gaming: Man Chai
Desc:
Namecard style.
"Don't stop believing, Man Chai. One day, we'll soar high, with nary a patched hole in our trousers."
Src: Reward for reaching Friendship Lv. 10 with Gaming.

Name: Xianyun: White Clouds
Desc:
Namecard style.
Those who the truth tell, commuted shall their sentence be. Be honest. When Cloud Retainer asked you, "Do you perceive one as merely some larger bird?", did you also append the thoughts, "Yes, and you talk, and fiddle with funny machines"?
Src: Reward for reaching Friendship Lv. 10 with Xianyun.

Name: Travel Notes: Time Inscribed
Desc:
Namecard style.
Who knows how long it shall take before film in Teyvat will advance to the point of reinventing the art of "carving time"? Still, this scene has indeed frozen the sinful past.

Name: Chevreuse: Type II
Desc:
Namecard style.
The standard issue weapon of the Special Security and Surveillance Patrol is known as the "Special Security and Surveillance Patrol Type II Standard Musket." Yet, though there may be countless flowers in this world, the one you treasure is special, even if it should be known to the world as nothing at all special.
Src: Reward for reaching Friendship 10 with Chevreuse

Name: Navia: Rosula
Desc:
Namecard style.
Roses shall bloom, and thus does Ms. Navia's umbrella flower. Yet beware, for roses have thorns, and Navia's booming brolly packs a powerful punch.
Src: Reward for reaching Friendship 10 with Navia

Name: Travel Notes: Whirling Waltz
Desc:
Namecard style.
Even if the clockwork stops ticking, even if the puppets stop stepping forward. Though our memories be frozen eternally as coral, do not forget our adventures and the time we spent together.

Name: Fontaine: Completeness
Desc:
Namecard style.
"The evening clouds scatter in the sky and the creek shines gold under the setting sun. My shadow wanders alone, akin to a lonely apparition at the bottom of a waterfall."
Src: Reward for completing all achievements under "Fontaine: Dance of the Dew-White Springs (III)"

Name: Charlotte: Exclusive
Desc:
Namecard style.
"One, I've written an exclusive, and it's going to generate a lot of buzz for sure! Two, the newspaper said the situation is developing too slowly, so they're changing to a press release instead... Three, the person writing the press release will be in the Opera Epiclese as the defendant tomorrow, so they've decided to run my piece after all!"
Src: Reward for reaching Friendship 10 with Charlotte

Name: Furina: Banquet
Desc:
Namecard style.
Can one person eat every cake? If they eat one per day, they should be able to enjoy cake for a week or so, right? But will the cakes stay fresh that long? Hmm... Well, don't worry, because there will be friends coming to eat the cakes together.
Src: Reward for reaching Friendship 10 with Furina

Name: Fontaine: Redemption
Desc:
Namecard style.
The official logo of the Fortress of Meropide. It is our dearest hope that all who wish to honor order and live out their lives in peace shall not ever be associated with the organization this insignia represents.
Src: Reward for completing all achievements under "Fontaine: Dance of the Dew-White Springs (II)"

Name: Achievement: Perpetual
Desc:
Namecard style.
"No one hears the dream that shattered between the conches and the gears. Only the tireless mechanical dancer still queries the echoes of the past day and night with its every elegant step."
Src: Reward for completing all achievements under "Challenger: Series VIII"

Name: Celebration: Euphonia
Desc:
Namecard style.
The trees sing on the slopes of a thousand mountain valleys, accompanied by the music of the passing rain.
Src: Obtained from the Genshin Concert event

Name: Travel Notes: Falling Star
Desc:
Namecard style.
Make a wish before you toss the arrow. If you manage to get it into the pot, who knows — your wish just might come true.

Name: Wriothesley: Detention
Desc:
Namecard style.
Maintaining order at the Fortress of Meropide is no simple affair. As such, a deft and sometimes firm hand is needed — along with a small pinch of truly regrettable cruelty.
Src: Reward for reaching Friendship 10 with Wriothesley

Name: Neuvillette: Surge
Desc:
Namecard style.
The water's surface may seem placid as a pristine gem, but it may yet be lying in wait for an opportune moment to gush forth.
Src: Reward for reaching Friendship 10 with Neuvillette

Name: Travel Notes: Primordial Waters
Desc:
Namecard style.
Timepieces accompany the tranquil passing of the years, as fish accompany the swirling of the clear waters of the font. If all that is must one day wither, why is my yearning as clear as ever?

Name: Fontaine: Big News
Desc:
Namecard style.
The trademarked logo of The Steambird. If you are discovered using it without first obtaining prior permission, we will uphold our rights and prosecute the offense to the fullest extent of the law!

Name: Fontaine: Wondrous Machine
Desc:
Namecard style.
The symbol of the energy blocks used by all of Fontaine's clockwork meka. There was once a great debate over whether it should be registered as a trademark, but in the end, the public was simply called upon not to use it too freely.

Name: Achievement: Mariner
Desc:
Namecard style.
The hands of travelers have touched ten thousand streams. They all flow from the same font of the world's waters, and all return to the same sea.
Src: Reward for completing all achievements under "Mortal Travails: Series IV"

Name: Achievement: Orbits
Desc:
Namecard style.
"O Almighty Sovereign, the Universitas Magistrorum has provided the predictions you requested: The two stars have been captured by the world's gravity... After a lengthy orbital period, today their paths shall intertwine once more."
Src: Reward for completing all achievements under "Meetings in Outrealm: Series IV"

Name: Fontaine: Judgment
Desc:
Namecard style.
The insignia of the new Hydro Archon. Even without any legal notice, it is understood that none dare use it without permission.
Src: Reward for completing all achievements under "Fontaine: Dance of the Dew-White Springs (I)"

Name: Freminet: Progress
Desc:
Namecard style.
As the clockwork devices do naught but round and round in circles turn, the dolls march forward.
Src: Reward for reaching Friendship 10 with Freminet

Name: Lynette: Earnestness
Desc:
Namecard style.
One major type of magic revolves around "appearing suddenly." Lynette is usually conserving her energy, but her serious side can "appear" as abruptly as pigeons from a hat.
Src: Reward for reaching Friendship 10 with Lynette

Name: Lyney: Pretense
Desc:
Namecard style.
One major type of magic revolves around making things "vanish." Lyney has an arsenal of tricks up his sleeve. As his accomplice, as long as you are willing to turn a blind eye, all your problems may vanish as well.
Src: Reward for reaching Friendship 10 with Lyney

Name: Travel Notes: Vivid Illumination
Desc:
Namecard style
Who knows? Perhaps the phantasmal light that only exists on the other side of this transparent glass can ever so slightly brighten up the world on this one.

Name: Travel Notes: Secrets
Desc:
Namecard style.
Never forget the time you once spent with games and good friends. Never forget what it feels like to have no worries about the future.

Name: Kirara: Neko Box
Desc:
Namecard style.
"To Kirara, the smiles on her customers' faces are the best rewards possible."
Src: Reward for reaching Friendship 10 with Kirara

Name: Travel Notes: Crown of Glory
Desc:
Namecard style.
"Knowledge serves as the crown of time, and reminiscence is bound to the time we shared as one."

Name: Sumeru: Amrita
Desc:
Namecard style.
The ancient Amrita Pool is suffused with recollections of times past. Perhaps it also contains the power that will create the future.
Src: Make 6 offerings to the Amrita Pool

Name: Sumeru: The Great Dream
Desc:
Namecard style.
"The time to flourish has yet to come. Hide me with care between the blades of grass and beneath the tallness of trees. Let me linger in that place of dreams."
Src: Reach Tree of Dreams's Favor Level 48

Name: Achievement: Transient Twilight
Desc:
Namecard style.
"I will forget the flowers of yesteryear, the daylight, the rain. I ask that you remember in my stead, in this nascent world, and hold to that lost dream."
Src: Reward for completing all achievements under "Challenger: Series VII"

Name: Achievement: Infinitum
Desc:
Namecard style.
"Oh, Khvarena in your endless forms, protect this imperiled land. The blights and glories of the earthly realm are naught but the illusion of existing seeds."
Src: Reward for completing all achievements under "Blessed Hamada"

Name: Kaveh: Domed Court
Desc:
Namecard style.
"When conceptualizing architecture, there is nothing wrong with imagining that the structure we build will surmount the firmament and outlast the stars."
Src: Reward for reaching Friendship 10 with Kaveh

Name: Baizhu: Relief
Desc:
Namecard style.
Sincerity begets longevity.
Src: Reward for reaching Friendship 10 with Baizhu

Name: Travel Notes: Artful Intent
Desc:
Namecard style.
It is said that experiencing true love is like seeing a ghost. Most folks speak of both as hearsay, but true witnesses remain few and far between. That said, since even ghosts can manifest here, perhaps true love is also waiting right around the next corner.

Name: Mika: Index
Desc:
Namecard style.
Every time he holds the map he illustrated in his hands, the boy feels like he is holding a small piece of rubbing of this world.
Src: Reward for reaching Friendship 10 with Mika

Name: Dehya: Purifying Flame
Desc:
Namecard style.
Those that should be burned will be reduced to fly ash, so that all the precious things that should be preserved can be revealed.
Src: Reward for reaching Friendship 10 with Dehya

Name: Sumeru: Sandstorm
Desc:
Namecard style.
The endless sandstorm conceals ancient dreams...
Src: Reward for completing all achievements under "Sumeru: The Gilded Desert - Series II"

Name: Travel Notes: Rhythm and Rhyme
Desc:
Namecard style.
With magnificent sunglow sheds light on the night sky, chimes are orchestrated to celebrate the bygone year. The gilded palaces are adorned with beaded curtains, the railings painted silver by bright moonlight, and the feasts brimmed with jolly singing and dances. Is that flowers or fireworks? A wealth of instruments plays in unison, harmonious and pleasant.

Name: Celebration: Lenticular Clouds
Desc:
Namecard style.
The floating clouds dispersed to the thousand peaks at dawn.

Name: Yaoyao: Yuegui
Desc:
Namecard style.
"Can you guess which one here is Yuegui? That's right, all of them are!"
Src: Reward for reaching Friendship 10 with Yaoyao

Name: Alhaitham: Enlightenment
Desc:
Namecard style.
"The only things researchers should abide by are debates and dialectics. Only by questioning everything at all times can one avoid falling into prejudice."
Src: Reward for reaching Friendship 10 with Alhaitham

Name: Travel Notes: Stellar Rivers
Desc:
Namecard style.
Forgotten is the name of the ancient feast, scattered are the three rivers amongst a plumage of clouds, and across the curve of twilight does autumn yet linger.

Name: Achievement: Invoker
Desc:
Namecard style.
"In this village, no one can defeat me!"
Src: Reward for completing all achievements under "Genius Invokation TCG"

Name: Faruzan: Sealed Secret
Desc:
Namecard style.
"A—Anyway! Next time, remember to refer to me as Madam Faruzan before you ask a question! Seriously..."
Src: Reward for reaching Friendship 10 with Faruzan

Name: Wanderer: Drifter's Ballad
Desc:
Namecard style.
In a world most transient does the past hide, and in the whims of flowing flowers does thin snow abide.
Src: Reward for reaching Friendship 10 with the Wanderer

Name: Travel Notes: Fungus Land
Desc:
Namecard style.
"Traveler, there is no need to grieve, for the wind at dawn will blow the fungal spores carrying beautiful dreams to the fields that contain your hopes..."

Name: Layla: Daydream
Desc:
Namecard style.
"The starry sky in your dreams will illuminate your way forward, on the premise that the crystal in your heart reflects clear lights."
Src: Reward for reaching Friendship 10 with Layla

Name: Nahida: Crescent
Desc:
Namecard style.
The rising moon admires the sun, because her light can shine all over the earth. On the other hand, the setting sun is envious of the moon, for she can be accompanied by the sweetest of dreams.
Src: Reward for reaching Friendship 10 with Nahida

Name: Achievement: Mirrored Dreams
Desc:
Namecard style.
"A millennium of obsession and tragic yearning has long been lost in the sandstorms of those blazing nights. But the eternal verdant oasis of her dreams is, in all likelihood, as tender as it was at the first..."
Src: Reward for completing all achievements under "Challenger: Series VI"

Name: Sumeru: Sandtreader
Desc:
Namecard style.
The sands subsume the tracks of travelers, and they await the day when a gust of wind will reveal gilded memories once more.
Src: Reward for completing all achievements under "Sumeru: The Gilded Desert - Series I"

Name: Achievement: Seven Lights
Desc:
Namecard style.
Anyone can play a tune that belongs just to them, and like the dew upon grass, can reflect the seven lights of heaven.
Src: Reward for completing all achievements under "Elemental Specialist: Series II"

Name: Nilou: Lotus Dance
Desc:
Namecard style.
The lotus that blooms amidst the pure water is naught but a flash of light beneath her toes.
Src: Reward for reaching Friendship 10 with Nilou

Name: Candace: Gray Heron
Desc:
Namecard style.
The burning winds of the past ruffle the heron's feathers, but the bird has eyes only for the morning star at first light.
Src: Reward for reaching Friendship 10 with Candace

Name: Cyno: Silence
Desc:
Namecard style.
Whenever Cyno falls into a profound silence, he must be considering some weighty judgment... Or perhaps he is simply considering something amusing.
Src: Reward for reaching Friendship 10 with Cyno

Name: Travel Notes: Returning Winds
Desc:
Namecard style.
The years come and go. Only remembrance and the winds that return do not change.

Name: Sumeru: Unsullied
Desc:
Namecard style.
The wise, graced with the thorough knowledge of the truth, will not be sullied by sin. They are like the Nilotpala Lotus, which remains clear and pure even after the rains and winds have passed.

Name: Sumeru: Observance
Desc:
Namecard style.
Behold everything the world has to offer; see through all that the sky's light surveys.

Name: Sumeru: Shimmering Woods
Desc:
Namecard style.
What dreams lie within the rich slumber of the stories deep in the woods?
Src: Reward for completing all achievements under "Sumeru: The Rainforest of Lore"

Name: Achievement: Fated Encounter
Desc:
Namecard style.
One day, our encounter at this moment shall shine like a star of reminiscence in our hearts.
Src: Reward for completing all achievements under "Meetings in Outrealm: Series III"

Name: Achievement: Roaming
Desc:
Namecard style.
Every journey and memory is a unique miracle that only belongs to the traveler.
Src: Reward for completing all achievements under "Mortal Travails: Series III"

Name: Travel Notes: Woodlands
Desc:
Namecard style.
Beneath the tranquil moon and inside the deep valley grows blooming roses. 'Tis a paradise with your presence.

Name: Dori: Jinni
Desc:
Namecard style.
If you wipe the lamp she gave you and then scrub the Mora you gave her, no wish is unattainable... right?
Src: Reward for reaching Friendship 10 with Dori

Name: Collei: Good Virtue
Desc:
Namecard style.
"I—It's Cuilein-Anbar! I, uh..."
Src: Reward for reaching Friendship 10 with Collei

Name: Tighnari: Dew-Kissed
Desc:
Namecard style.
Tighnari takes good care of his big, fluffy tail. The essential oil he uses was extracted from flowers and mixed together meticulously. It gives off a faint, calming scent.
Src: Reward for reaching Friendship 10 with Tighnari

Name: Travel Notes: Azure Main
Desc:
Namecard style.
Years have gone by, and you wake from an old dream. Inside the keepsake shell, lingers the blue ocean of those summer days.

Name: Shikanoin Heizou: Temari
Desc:
Namecard style.
A Temari of entwining strings in various colors. It must have taken someone's great effort to make such an item, yet Heizou only sees it as a simple game to untangle each string.
Src: Reward for reaching Friendship 10 with Shikanoin Heizou

Name: Travel Notes: Divine Will
Desc:
Namecard style.
"Once upon a time, loyal souls did scatter east and west like swan geese." "Today I light my lantern, that they may not lose their way."

Name: Kuki Shinobu: Net
Desc:
Namecard style.
"You know those Naku Weed rings they have in Inazuma? You know, the kind that can drive out evil? Shinobu got the idea that since wicked things won't cross their boundaries willingly, we could make them into items that could be actively used. Ah, her talent for being a shrine maiden truly is frightening..."
Src: Reward for reaching Friendship 10 with Kuki Shinobu

Name: Yelan: Throw
Desc:
Namecard style.
"Dice are always quite hard to make 'fair.' That goes double for dice with shoddier workmanship. The weighting on each numbered side will almost certainly be unbalanced."
Src: Reward for reaching Friendship 10 with Yelan

Name: Travel Notes: Irodori
Desc:
Namecard style.
Those who share a hobby are known as a group as "fans." Best come up with those stories, everyone, before the kitsune editor-in-chief dreams up copyright law... Or perhaps she has already dreamed it up, but does not altogether mind?

Name: Achievement: Chasm
Desc:
Namecard style.
Where once miners industriously delved and tunneled, now all is silent. Only the Glazed Sand Crystal and marrows of stone, both millennia-old, still give off any brilliance.
Src: Reward for completing all achievements under "Chasmlighter"

Name: Achievement: Thunderclap
Desc:
Namecard style.
Listen to the sound that comes from the clouds. That is its resentful rage, and its tiny wish.
Src: Reward for completing all achievements under "Challenger: Series V"

Name: Lumens: Stone of Light
Desc:
Namecard style.
What flows within this nameless, voiceless azure crystal? The secrets of the heavens? Or the whispers of the abyss?
Src: Reward for enhancing the Lumenstone Adjuvant to Lv. 10

Name: Kamisato Ayato: Ripple
Desc:
Namecard style.
The camellia alights upon the mirrored pond, sending ripples throughout the water.
Src: Reward for reaching Friendship 10 with Kamisato Ayato

Name: Travel Notes: Awakening
Desc:
Namecard style.
The three realms quake, heaven and earth awaken. The Sangacorexes, too, rise again from their eternal slumber.

Name: Yae Miko: Kitsune Dreaming
Desc:
Namecard style.
Where can Yae Miko's fox form be found? In your dreams, that's where.
Src: Reward for reaching Friendship Lv. 10 with Yae Miko

Name: Celebration: Binge Vessel
Desc:
Namecard.
There's a great many stories here, but no alcohol, so it's safe for Paimon to drink.
Src: Obtained from the "Of Drink A-Dreaming" event

Name: Travel Notes: Flowing Hues
Desc:
Namecard style.
The luxurious colors flow past — all things are renewed.

Name: Inazuma: Tokoyo
Desc:
Namecard style.
"O Mighty Sun! What use are your heat and light if you cannot own all that they survey?"
Src: Reward for completing all achievements under "The Light of Day"

Name: Yun Jin: Rhyme
Desc:
Namecard style.
Ms. Yun has two sorts of teachers. The critics of her onstage performances are one, and the books on rhyme she references while writing are the other.
Src: Reward for reaching Friendship Lv. 10 with Yun Jin

Name: Shenhe: Comb
Desc:
Namecard style.
The early onset of white hair is often correlated to one's sorrows. Since "comb" and "scatter" are similarly read in Liyue's language, they believe that combing one's hair is the same as scattering one's misfortunes.
Src: Reward for reaching Friendship Lv. 10 with Shenhe

Name: Travel Notes: Lyratum
Desc:
Namecard.
Only this flower remains on the heights where all trees have withered.

Name: Itto: Oni Face
Desc:
Namecard style.
A real man puts sorrow and anger behind him and smiles brightly for the world to see!
Src: Reward for reaching Friendship Lv. 10 with Itto

Name: Gorou: Leisurely Hound
Desc:
Namecard style.
As long as you believe in the path you are walking, then everything you encounter on your journey will be a source of happiness.
Src: Reward for reaching Friendship 10 with Gorou

Name: Inazuma: Eagleplume
Desc:
Namecard style.
Pirka chikappo! Kapatcir kamuy!
Src: Reward for completing all achievements under "The Chronicles of the Sea of Fog"

Name: Travel Notes: Heavenly General
Desc:
Namecard style.
"You were not created to punish evil. But as to what your purpose is... I fear that I, too, do not know."

Name: Thoma: Blazing Guard
Desc:
Namecard style.
Blazing armor, flaming guards.
Src: Reward for reaching Friendship 10 with Thoma

Name: Celebration: Ikki
Desc:
Namecard style.
"I will ask you a question, and you shall answer me with your sword."
Src: Obtained from the Hyakunin Ikki event

Name: Celebration: Tuneful Delight
Desc:
Namecard style.
O stars and mountains above, listen to my song!

Name: Achievement: Nails
Desc:
Namecard style.
"Wait, if these fish can't be eaten, then why are we hammering these nails into fishhooks?" "Oh, you wouldn't understand."
Src: Reward for completing all achievements under "Teyvat Fishing Guide: Series I"

Name: Inazuma: Sangonomiya Crest
Desc:
Namecard style.
This is the emblem of the Sangonomiya Clan, the leaders of Watatsumi's people.
Src: Reward for completing all achievements under "Inazuma: The Islands of Thunder and Eternity - Series II."

Name: Travel Notes: Moonchaser
Desc:
Namecard style.
May the moonlight wash over you, O pursuer!

Name: Aloy: Dawn
Desc:
Namecard style.
"Everything I do is in the service of life, not death."
Src: Reward for reaching Friendship 10 with Aloy

Name: Kujou Sara: Tengu
Desc:
Namecard style.
Kujou Sara may have forsaken the arrogant life of the tengu race, but she has never neglected their brilliance with the sword or their supernatural might.
Src: Reward for reaching Friendship 10 with Kujou Sara

Name: Sangonomiya Kokomi: The Deep
Desc:
Namecard style.
All Watatsumi islanders know this tale: that deep beneath the waves lies their former home.
Src: Reward for reaching Friendship 10 with Sangonomiya Kokomi

Name: Raiden Shogun: Enlightenment
Desc:
Namecard style.
Not simply Ei, and not merely the Raiden Shogun. Observe yourself also with one stormy eye, and you will someday reach a breakthrough.
Src: Reward for reaching Friendship 10 with the Raiden Shogun

Name: Celebration: Wondrous Calculation
Desc:
Namecard style.
A true grandmaster can see the board a thousand steps ahead.
Src: Obtained by completing the Theater Mechanicus: Stage of Wonders event

Name: Inazuma: Kujou Insignia
Desc:
Namecard style.
This Tri-Commission house-crest represents the Tenryou Commission's Kujou Clan.
Src: Reward for completing all achievements under "Inazuma: The Islands of Thunder and Eternity"

Name: Achievement: Full Bloom
Desc:
Namecard style.
Gather ye then soil from all corners of the universe, and from it may countless flowers grow.
Src: Reward for completing all achievements under "A Realm Beyond: Series III"

Name: Achievement: Stone Dragon
Desc:
Namecard style.
Our journey among the precipices.
Src: Reward for completing all achievements under "Challenger: Series IV"

Name: Achievement: Traversal
Desc:
Namecard style.
A traveler shall experience ten thousand tales, and each shall form a part of the traveler's soul.
Src: Reward for completing all achievements under "Mortal Travails: Series II"

Name: Achievement: Gate
Desc:
Namecard style.
What encounters lie on the other side of this door?
Src: Reward for completing all achievements under "Meetings in Outrealm: Series II"

Name: Inazuma: Kamisato Crest
Desc:
Namecard style.
This Tri-Commission house-crest represents the Yashiro Commission's Kamisato Clan.

Name: Inazuma: Raiden Emblem
Desc:
Namecard style.
This is the emblem of the Ogosho Shogun, and is the banner of her troops, the Electro Mitsudomoe.

Name: Sayu: Muji-Muji Daruma
Desc:
Namecard style.
It is even smaller than Sayu, sure, but it can help her do the things she doesn't want to do.
Src: Reward for reaching Friendship 10 with Sayu

Name: Yoimiya: Auratus Spark
Desc:
Namecard style.
Even momentary sparks can leave beautiful, unquenchable flames in the hearts of those who watch the night sky.
Src: Reward for reaching Friendship 10 with Yoimiya

Name: Kamisato Ayaka: Folding Fan
Desc:
Namecard style.
Ayaka does constantly change out the fans she carries with her, of course. If you're buying her some as gifts, remember not to send summer fans or throwing fans. Dancing fans or tea fans are good choices, though.
Src: Reward for reaching Friendship 10 with Ayaka

Name: Travel Notes: Grand Narukami Shrine
Desc:
Namecard style.
The sakura of Mt. Yougou symbolizes the Grand Narukami Shrine.

Name: Inazuma: Sacred Sakura
Desc:
Namecard style.
Wherever the sakura petals fall, there the protection of the sacred tree rests.

Name: Celebration: Battlesong
Desc:
Namecard style.
Good omens must appear thrice for good fortune to come. One bows thrice at curtain call. The opponents to defeat number three.
Src: Obtained from the Legend of the Vagabond Sword event

Name: Celebration: Kaboomball
Desc:
Namecard style.
"In a land far, far away, there was a kingdom known as the Grand Alliance, and the people living there could throw ever-changing, quick, and powerful Kaboomballs."
Src: Obtained from the Kaboomball Kombat event

Name: Celebration: Vastness
Desc:
Namecard style.
Imagine the vast expanse of a sea of stars. Imagine a one followed by a hundred zeros.

Name: Achievement: Vacation Home
Desc:
Namecard style.
The world is wide under the eaves.
Src: Reward for completing all achievements under "A Realm Beyond: Series II"

Name: Travel Notes: Midsummer
Desc:
Namecard style.
It's adventure time!

Name: Kaedehara Kazuha: Autumn Maple-Viewing
Desc:
Namecard style.

The deeper you delve, the more secrets you shall uncover.

Even if you're just going out to get a single dandelion, there will be obstacles in your path. But you love a challenge, don't you?

Draw that bowstring taut!

Light can refract into countless colors, but people stop at seven because they're lazy to count. Perhaps the elements are like that, too.

Witness the lonely, cloud-covered peaks of Liyue.

Desc:
Namecard style.
Listen to the singing of Mondstadt's birds and winds.
Src: Reward for completing all achievements under "Mondstadt: The City of Wind and Song"

Name: Achievement: Hero
Desc:
Namecard style.
Your hero's journey began before you knew it, but it's the experiences that really made it special.

Name: Achievement: Virtuoso
Desc:
Namecard style.
After mastering these skills, you may just find that you can get by just fine without engaging in battle. If you are without any commission to complete, that is.
Src: Reward for completing all achievements under "The Art of Adventure"

Name: Achievement: Explorer
Desc:
Namecard style.
After all your wanderings throughout the world, do not forget the reason why you first set out.
Src: Reward for completing all achievements under "Mortal Travails: Series I"

Name: Keqing: Lightning Stiletto
Desc:
Namecard style.
It was originally invented to just test out one's surroundings and climb to high places, really...
Src: Reward for reaching Friendship 10 with Keqing

Namecard style.
What should be kept in the fridge? Dr. Baizhu's herbs, coconut milk... and Hu Tao.

Namecard style.
Come watch the night rain that brings no rainbow.

Namecard style.
A sign of recognition from Benny's Adventure Team.

A girl gazes down at the stars' reflection on the water, pondering the joys and sorrows of life.

Noelle is quite special. Noelle won't let any harm come to you.

Namecard style.
A raven dark as midnight with wings that can block out the sun. "I permit thee to conceive his likeness upon such decoration!"

Desc:
Namecard style.
If you closely examine an Anemo Hypostasis before it disappears, you will discover that they are actually quite square.

Desc:
Namecard style.
An hourglass marks the end of the work day for Lisa. Its sand moves fast.
Src: Reward for reaching Friendship 10 with Lisa

Desc:
Namecard style.
The pattern of peacock feathers resembles eyes that never shut. Can we really say that this Pavo Ocellus is missing an eye...?
Src: Reward for reaching Friendship 10 with Kaeya

Name: Barbara: Flow
Desc:
Namecard style.
When Barbara sings, her melodic voice flows like the tender healing of a clear spring.
Src: Reward for reaching Friendship 10 with Barbara

Name: Jean: The Winds' Course
Desc:
Namecard style.
The dandelion, also called "lion's fang" by some, is the flower most sensitive to the direction of the wind.
Src: Reward for reaching Friendship 10 with Jean

Name: Venti: Azure Sky
Desc:
Namecard style.
The bright blue of a cloudless sky and the melodious tone of Der Frühling complement each other perfectly.
Src: Reward for reaching Friendship 10 with Venti

Name: Razor: Wolvensprint
Desc:
Namecard style.
It's quite a sight to behold Razor and the wolves prepare their dinner, but they won't let Klee or the Traveler see the slightly gruesome affair.
Src: Reward for reaching Friendship 10 with Razor

Name: Diluc: Flames
Desc:
Namecard style.
Master Crepus painted many eagles during his lifetime, but he never could've foreseen creating an eagle with such fire.
Src: Reward for reaching Friendship 10 with Diluc

Name: Klee: Explosive
Desc:
Namecard style.
Klee's lucky explosive — can you tell if it's Jumpy Dumpty or Dodoco? (Hint: Look carefully at the tail...)
Src: Reward for reaching Friendship 10 with Klee

Name: Amber: Bunny
Desc:
Namecard style.
"It's Baron Bunny!"
Src: Reward for reaching Friendship 10 with Amber

Name: Travel Notes: Catch the Wind
Desc:
Namecard style.
The most difficult part of writing a travel journal is coming up with the beginning.

Name: Genshin Impact: A New World
Desc:
Namecard style.
"Welcome to Teyvat!"

Name: Strength Tonic
Desc: A potion of mysterious origins that has a simple formula. Some might even call it a healthy drink. As the name suggests, it can make people stronger.
Eff: Increases all party members' Physical DMG by 45%, CRIT Rate by 10%, and DMG taken by 20% for 30s. In Co-Op Mode, this effect only applies to your own character(s).

Name: "Pure Water"
Desc: It is said to be the legacy of a genius potioneer. It can draw out the purest strength from within one's body.
Eff: Increases all party members' ATK by 320, CRIT Rate by 10%, and damage taken by 20% for 30s. In Co-Op Mode, this effect only applies to your own character(s).

Name: "Chatter of Joyful Nights"
Desc: Dahlia's specialty dish. "Ahem, I received a divine revelation instructing you to try this," a certain deacon says with a wink, presenting a plate of golden treats. Noting his polite and... somewhat expectant gaze, paired with the aroma of sweet apple cider, one might wonder — is this really divine instruction?
Eff: Restores 34% of Max HP to the selected character and regenerates 980 HP every 5s for 30s.

Name: "Abyssal Bounty"
Desc: Skirk's specialty. An abnormally ferocious catch. Though thoroughly cooked, it still manages to intimidate at first glance. After summoning up the courage for a bite, an otherworldly deliciousness overwhelms your senses. Where did she even catch this fish? A sudden and unsettling suspicion arises... S—Surely not...
Eff: Restores 16% of Max HP and an additional 1,350 HP to the selected character.

Name: Delicious Bubblemilk Pie
Desc: An innovative stuffed dessert. This sweet indulgence begins with a crisp crackle of golden crust. Warm filling then cascades across your palate as bubbles meet and pop between your teeth, taking you on a journey across an unending spectrum of textures... This is the perfect finale to any feast!
Eff: Increases all party members' DEF by 235 for 300s. In Co-Op Mode, this effect only applies to your own character(s).

Name: Bubblemilk Pie
Desc: An innovative stuffed dessert. Crispy puff pastry, creamy filling, and the surprising sensation of bubbles bursting in sequence... This post-meal treat brings satisfaction to every taste bud. Remember to enjoy it while it's warm!
Eff: Increases all party members' DEF by 200 for 300s. In Co-Op Mode, this effect only applies to your own character(s).

Name: Suspicious Bubblemilk Pie
Desc: An innovative stuffed dessert. The bursting bubbles send waves of pain across your tongue — combined with the imagery of their green and crispy coatings, the experience is not unlike cramming exploding Dendro Cores into your mouth...
Eff: Increases all party members' DEF by 165 for 300s. In Co-Op Mode, this effect only applies to your own character(s).

Name: Delicious Nine-Fruit Nectar
Desc: A blended juice cocktail. With just one sip, you feel like you've been enveloped in a waterfall of fruit. The sweet aroma of nature's bounty fills your nostrils — each mouthful a perfect harmony of fruity flavors. When the heatwaves strike, this drink is sure to provide salvation for the soul!
Eff: Increases all party members' CRIT Rate by 20% for 300s. In Co-Op Mode, this effect only applies to your own character(s).

Name: Nine-Fruit Nectar
Desc: A blended juice cocktail. Mixed with balanced precision, the drink interweaves the flavors of various fruits and preserves their sweet and tangy deliciousness, elevated by a handful of ice cubes.
Eff: Increases all party members' CRIT Rate by 15% for 300s. In Co-Op Mode, this effect only applies to your own character(s).

Name: Suspicious Nine-Fruit Nectar
Desc: A blended juice cocktail. It's sour and bitter on the palate... and somehow manages to have a salty aftertaste? Every sensation seems present except for the sweetness you desire. Such a complex and unusual flavor profile... Did someone accidentally introduce a medicinal concoction to the mix?
Eff: Increases all party members' CRIT Rate by 10% for 300s. In Co-Op Mode, this effect only applies to your own character(s).

Name: Delicious Meat-Lover's Feast
Desc: A combo meal of meat and coffee. The special sauce emits an enticing aroma that swirls throughout the air as though diffused by the power of Anemo itself, while the succulent, delectably fresh shrimp dances on your tongue, each bite bursting with juicy, multi-layered bliss... Even as your belly grows full, you pray that this meat-lover's dream never ends!
Eff: Increases all party members' ATK by 320 and CRIT Rate by 10% for 300s. In Co-Op Mode, this effect only applies to your own character(s).

Name: Meat-Lover's Feast
Desc: A combo meal of meat and coffee. A crispy fried chicken cutlet wrapped in fresh greens, paired with peeled shrimp tails. This bold marriage of flavors hailing from land and water sparks an epiphany: Culinary delights, like an adventure into uncharted lands, are full of infinite possibilities.
Eff: Increases all party members' ATK by 272 and CRIT Rate by 8% for 300s. In Co-Op Mode, this effect only applies to your own character(s).

Name: Suspicious Meat-Lover's Feast
Desc: A combo meal of meat and coffee. It's a chaotic medley of ingredients haphazardly jammed together. At a glance, it appears to be... um, food made from combining meat and shrimp? If you can overlook its jumbled appearance, it'll fill your stomach just fine...
Eff: Increases all party members' ATK by 224 and CRIT Rate by 6% for 300s. In Co-Op Mode, this effect only applies to your own character(s).

Name: Delicious Drink 455
Desc: A specially-blended drink that's all the rage right now. Refreshing beyond belief, this invigorating beverage washes over you like sweet rain after a long drought, instantly melting away all fatigue and restlessness. "It's as if everything's finally right with the world!" was one customer's glowing review after finishing their glass.
Eff: Revives a character and restores 1,500 HP.

Name: Drink 455
Desc: A specially-blended drink that's all the rage right now. Besides its smooth and refreshing taste, it's known for replenishing lost energy from long bouts of physical exertion. Why not try a bottle when you're feeling parched?
Eff: Revives a character and restores 1,200 HP.

Name: Suspicious Drink 455
Desc: A specially-blended drink that's all the rage right now. Except... you're not sure if there's something wrong with the formula, or you didn't mix the ingredients enough. The sour bits are too sour, the sweet bits are too sweet — and the fact that you can tell apart the "bits" in a liquid beverage is probably cause for concern...
Eff: Revives a character and restores 900 HP.

Name: Autumn Frost
Desc: Escoffier's inspired creation. Layers of swirling chestnut cream paint the outline of Mont Automnequi, while a dusting of powdered sugar nestles on top, like frost clinging to the mountain slopes. The powerful aroma of chestnuts blends perfectly with the light and airy cream, leaving you licking your lips for more. You might say that Escoffier has summited the pinnacle of the culinary arts with this one.
Eff: Restores 42% of Max HP and an additional 2850 HP to the selected character.

Name: Gilded Hall
Desc: Escoffier's inspired creation. The crispy crust is like a small, golden castle, stoutly protecting chunks of succulent eel, juicy squab, and tender foie gras, all swimming in a rich mushroom sauce. A chorus of different flavors hits your tongue at once, with a complexity and richness deserving of its own footnote in history. Escoffier's culinary tour de force is enough to move you to your very soul.
Eff: Increases all party members' ATK by 372 and CRIT DMG by 24% for 300s. In Co-Op Mode, this effect only applies to your own character(s).

Name: Wave-Kissed Sands
Desc: Escoffier's inspired creation. Flowing cream crashes onto the palate like surf on the crest of a breaking wave, revealing the silky, velvety broth beneath. The soft, rich texture of the soup is a testament to the chef's masterful arts — one imbued with a mystical warmth.
Eff: Decreases all party members' sprinting and swimming Stamina consumption by 25% for 900s. In Co-Op Mode, this effect only applies to your own character(s).

Name: Verdant Gift
Desc: Escoffier's inspired creation. A well-presented asparagus salad presented like a lush, green bouquet and drizzled with yellowy-orange sauce. A fresh, crisp mouthful that captures the vitality of soft, young shoots at the very instant they break the surface of the soil — it's almost as though Escoffier has moved beyond mastering the careful control of heat and flavor and is now cooking with time itself.
Eff: Increases all party members' ATK by 320 and CRIT Rate by 10% for 300s. In Co-Op Mode, this effect only applies to your own character(s).

Name: Emotional Support
Desc: Ifa's specialty. "Eat up, bro." The voices of a human and a saurian follow one after the other as Ifa brings you a plate of fragrant cookies and Cacucu follows it up with a cup of rich Xocoatl — barely delivered with an enormous flapping of the wings. Caught between these competing aromas, your unexplained anxiety dissolves away... Awesome work, bro!
Eff: Increases all party members' DEF by 282 for 300s. In Co-Op Mode, this effect only applies to your own character(s).

Name: Gateau Debord: Magnifique
Desc: Escoffier's specialty. Its lavish appearance is even more dazzling than any gateau you've seen before. It has an aura that captivates at first glance and a taste that is impossible not to love, like a soft, warm blanket that envelops every tastebud and suffuses your body with joy... Without a doubt, Escoffier's culinary talents have quietly reached new heights.
Eff: Increases all party members' ATK by 384 and CRIT Rate by 14% for 300s. In Co-Op Mode, this effect only applies to your own character(s).

Name: Delicious Candy Shells
Desc: Candies in a variety of different shapes. Their vibrant colors make them resemble gleaming gemstones resting majestically in an exquisite box, waiting to give their finder a sweet surprise. What could make someone happier than a trip to the Chevalmarin Film Fantasyland? Why, a trip to the Chevalmarin Film Fantasyland and a box of Candy Shells!
Eff: Increases all party members' Shield Strength by 35% and DEF by 235 for 300s. In Co-Op Mode, this effect only applies to your own character(s).

Name: Candy Shells
Desc: Candies in a variety of different shapes. It is said that a tiny fraction of the Candy Shells sold at the Chevalmarin Film Fantasyland contain real pearls, and that the pleasure of tasting these is reserved for only the very luckiest of visitors. Might you be one of them?
Eff: Increases all party members' Shield Strength by 30% and DEF by 200 for 300s. In Co-Op Mode, this effect only applies to your own character(s).

Name: Suspicious Candy Shells
Desc: Candies in a variety of different shapes. The powdered sugar coating has a grainy texture, reminiscent of grit trapped in an oyster's shell. Perhaps only those willing to battle through the coarseness of this coating will earn the right to enjoy the spoils within — sweet candy.
Eff: Increases all party members' Shield Strength by 25% and DEF by 165 for 300s. In Co-Op Mode, this effect only applies to your own character(s).

Name: Delicious Petit Gateau Debord: Revised Version
Desc: A petite version of the famous Gateau Debord. The velvety sauce is like elusive silk, slipping between your fingers and alighting on your tongue, while the gentle melodies of afternoon tea circle in the air, enchanting your heart... Perhaps this little treat will appear before you again in your dreams tonight...
Eff: Increases all party members' ATK by 320 and CRIT Rate by 10% for 300s. In Co-Op Mode, this effect only applies to your own character(s).

Name: Petit Gateau Debord: Revised Version
Desc: A petite version of the famous Gateau Debord. Even when compared to its namesake, of which only sixteen slices are sold each day, the extraordinary adventures you've experienced together are yet more precious and worthy of remembrance still. Perhaps when Escoffier scribbled down this recipe, she was thinking along these same lines...
Eff: Increases all party members' ATK by 272 and CRIT Rate by 8% for 300s. In Co-Op Mode, this effect only applies to your own character(s).

Name: Suspicious Petit Gateau Debord: Revised Version
Desc: A petite version of the famous Gateau Debord. The small cake is like a piece of driftwood lost in a vast ocean, while the thick chocolate sauce is like a surging wave, enveloping not just the cake — and much of the plate — but also any tiny lingering foothold that hunger might have held in your stomach.
Eff: Increases all party members' ATK by 224 and CRIT Rate by 6% for 300s. In Co-Op Mode, this effect only applies to your own character(s).

Name: Delicious Harvest's Boon
Desc: A luxurious, flavor-packed meal held together by the humble Grainfruit. Your anticipation soars even as the oven's heat does, and once you taste it, the sweetness of Grainfruit and the savoriness of the minced meat break out into a joyful dance on your taste buds... Huh, your hands and legs are instinctively swaying along to the beat.
Eff: A little surprise from the Collective of Plenty.

Name: Harvest's Boon
Desc: A rich and comforting meal held together by the humble Grainfruit. Minced meat is stir-fried and placed in a baking pan with larger chunks of meat and eggs. The whole thing is then covered with a layer of mashed Grainfruit and baked until a tantalizing golden brown. This hearty dish can often be found on the tables of the Collective of Plenty during harvest festivals.
Eff: A little surprise from the Collective of Plenty.

Name: Suspicious Harvest's Boon
Desc: A strange-looking meal barely held together by the humble Grainfruit. The blackened outer shell reminds you of the importance of heat control. Considering the time and effort you spent gathering the ingredients... Maybe the inside's not as burnt. Perhaps it's still worth a try?
Eff: A little surprise from the Collective of Plenty.

Name: Mt. Mushroom (For One)
Desc: Varesa's specialty. The young lady, with all the air of a bright pink marshmallow, effortlessly serves this mountainous dish with one hand. The fragrance of mushrooms, mingling with cheese, has you reaching for your cutlery before you even know it. Hey, umm... Is it even possible to finish eating this much food in a day?
Eff: Increases all party members' CRIT Rate by 16% for 300s. In Co-Op Mode, this effect only applies to your own character(s).

Name: Gold-Standard Healthy Meal
Desc: Iansan's specialty. A gold-standard meal, prepped by a gold-standard coach. The freshest ingredients are portioned to perfection and packed full of nutrients, with too many benefits to count! If you can bear eating it daily, maybe you too shall become a gold-standard trainee.
Eff: Revives a character and restores 15% of Max HP, then restores an additional 550 HP.

Name: Delicious Cheesy Mushroom Skewer
Desc: A skewer covered in golden-brown, mouth-watering cheese. The mushrooms are almost as thick as steak. Although they don't smell like meat, the taste is far more splendid. A single bite blesses your whole mouth with the fragrant flavors packed within, as juicy joy overflows in abundance.
Eff: Increases all party members' CRIT Rate by 12% for 300s. In Co-Op Mode, this effect only applies to your own character(s).

Name: Cheesy Mushroom Skewer
Desc: A skewer covered in mouth-watering cheese. The caps of Red Berryshrooms are removed, filled with a generous sprinkling of cheese, and then grilled to perfection. The rich aroma carries a faint fruity tang best enjoyed while hot.
Eff: Increases all party members' CRIT Rate by 9% for 300s. In Co-Op Mode, this effect only applies to your own character(s).

Name: Suspicious Cheesy Mushroom Skewer
Desc: A skewer covered in burnt cheese. The acrid smell gives notice that the Red Berryshroom has been reduced to a Black Burnedshroom. It looks so awful that you wonder if you might have turned a harmless mushroom into a poisonous one...
Eff: Increases all party members' CRIT Rate by 6% for 300s. In Co-Op Mode, this effect only applies to your own character(s).

Name: Delicious Magma Eggs
Desc: A jet-black egg, with a beautiful frosty sheen observable in its darkness. Like a chunk of black jade slumbering in the mist, it's no wonder there are rumors about how it can prolong one's lifespan. That said, one can only hope it doesn't have the opposite effect...
Eff: Restores 10% of Max HP and an additional 1,200 HP to the selected character.

Name: Magma Eggs
Desc: A jet-black egg, formed by absorbing the essence of flame and rock. Despite its obsidian appearance, it tastes just like a regular boiled egg — unless, of course, one were to go out of their way to cook it in an irregular fashion...
Eff: Restores 9% of Max HP and an additional 1,000 HP to the selected character.

Name: Suspicious Magma Eggs
Desc: A jet-black egg with a crust that has trapped too much heat from overcooking. The ominous color of the shell makes you feel uneasy, and you can't help but fear that something horrible will happen if you take a bite!
Eff: Best not to eat this!

Name: Delicious Puffed Grainfruit Bars
Desc: A tantalizing, technicolor treat. Once you hear that delightful crunch, your mouth will be filled with a sweet and fruity fragrance, and your heart will be filled with joy. This is the power of the fabled "Pocket Money Pilferer"!
Eff: Restores 24% of Max HP and an additional 1,500 HP to the selected character.

Name: Puffed Grainfruit Bars
Desc: A tasty, technicolor treat that is delightfully crisp and sweet. When displayed prominently on snack stands, it possesses an almost magical ability to make children's pocket money disappear.
Eff: Restores 22% of Max HP and an additional 1,200 HP to the selected character.

Name: Suspicious Puffed Grainfruit Bars
Desc: A turgid, technicolor treat that has been cursed with a bland texture. Eating it almost feels like eating nothing at all. The only evidence left behind is the stains on your teeth.
Eff: Restores 20% of Max HP and an additional 900 HP to the selected character.

Name: Delicious Fruits Aplenty
Desc: Fresh and flavorful fruit juice made from a selection of the finest ingredients. This otherworldly fragrance feels like being plunged into a fruit garden, bathed in gentle dawn-light, where dew-slick fruits melt into honey on the tongue, lifting your spirits and filling you with energy... Wait, why are your legs carrying you towards the gym?
Eff: Restores 30% of Max HP to the selected character and regenerates 790 HP every 5s for 30s.

Name: Fruits Aplenty
Desc: Fresh and flavorful fruit juice made from a variety of ingredients. Its invigorating and healthy properties have made it a firm favorite among the fitness-obsessed tribespeople of the Collective of Plenty, who often recommend drinking two glasses a day.
Eff: Restores 28% of Max HP to the selected character and regenerates 620 HP every 5s for 30s.

Name: Suspicious Fruits Aplenty
Desc: Curiously flavored fruit juice made from a variety of ingredients. The sour Cacahuatl, the fibrous Grainfruit, the bitter Quenepa Berries, and the gooey eggs... They battle for attention on your taste buds, but you can't drum up the patience to let them finish. You desperately need a glass of water to wash it all down.
Eff: Restores 26% of Max HP to the selected character and regenerates 450 HP every 5s for 30s.

Name: Delicious Cheesy Crab Hotpot
Desc: A glittering, gold-topped feast. The sweetness of crab meat is like the first ray of dawn that pierces the clouds. The dense, savory aroma of cheese invites the radiance of the morning sun onto your tastebuds, bathing your mouth in a warm, golden glow. The sensation of bliss sweeps a soul-warming path from your tongue to your stomach, uniting all your senses in adoration.
Eff: Increases all party members' Max HP by 30% and Energy Recharge by 20% for 300s. In Co-Op Mode, this effect only applies to your own character(s).

Name: Cheesy Crab Hotpot
