Name: Satisfying Salad
Desc: A vegetable salad. Not just steamed potatoes and fresh vegetables, but also a hard-boiled egg to top it off. Satisfying to both the eyes and stomach.
Eff: Increases all party members' CRIT Rate by 9% for 300s. In Co-Op Mode, this effect only applies to your own character(s).

Name: Suspicious Satisfying Salad
Desc: A vegetable salad. Regrettably, it seems the best time to plate the potatoes and boiled eggs was missed.
Eff: Increases all party members' CRIT Rate by 6% for 300s. In Co-Op Mode, this effect only applies to your own character(s).

Name: Delicious Fried Radish Balls
Desc: Fried Radish Balls. It's insane that something so delicious comes from plain old radishes! All who eat them will truly understand Liyue's culinary reputation.
Eff: Increases all party members' ATK by 95 for 300s. In Co-Op Mode, this effect only applies to your own character(s).

Name: Fried Radish Balls
Desc: Fried Radish Balls. Fragrant and crispy. Make sure to eat them while they're hot! Said to be a recipe from Liyue.
Eff: Increases all party members' ATK by 81 for 300s. In Co-Op Mode, this effect only applies to your own character(s).

Name: Suspicious Fried Radish Balls
Desc: Fried Radish Balls. Way too oily, and leaves you looking for something to drink to cut through the grease.
Eff: Increases all party members' ATK by 66 for 300s. In Co-Op Mode, this effect only applies to your own character(s).

Name: Delicious Tea Break Pancake
Desc: A stack of round pancakes. Tender and fluffy, the sweet-smelling pancakes taste like clouds. A heavenly delicacy, no doubt.
Eff: Revives a character and restores 550 HP.

Name: Tea Break Pancake
Desc: A stack of round pancakes. A staple originating from afternoon tea in manors. Only the best berries should be picked for this dish.
Eff: Revives a character and restores 400 HP.

Name: Suspicious Tea Break Pancake
Desc: A stack of round pancakes. A burnt scent masks what you can only assume should be a sweet taste. The berries are the only thing saving this dish.
Eff: Revives a character and restores 250 HP.

Name: Delicious Radish Veggie Soup
Desc: Radish-based vegetable soup. The clear aromas are perfectly accompanied by a sunny summer afternoon.
Eff: Restores 10% of Max HP to the selected character and regenerates 300 HP every 5s for 30s.

Name: Radish Veggie Soup
Desc: Radish-based vegetable soup. Its flavor is delicately between tart and sweet. With luscious radish, it's a well-balanced dish.
Eff: Restores 9% of Max HP to the selected character and regenerates 260 HP every 5s for 30s.

Name: Suspicious Radish Veggie Soup
Desc: Radish-based vegetable soup. The vegetables within appear to have been victims of a frost.
Eff: Restores 8% of Max HP to the selected character and regenerates 210 HP every 5s for 30s.

Name: Mysterious Bolognese
Desc: Lisa's specialty. With an inexplicable aura, this bolognese is so exotic that you can never have enough. Did she actually enchant it with some kind of magic?
Eff: Restores 26% of Max HP to the selected character and regenerates 570 HP every 5s for 30s.

Name: Delicious Flaming Red Bolognese
Desc: Bolognese covered with a meat sauce. The beautiful, authentic flavors take you on a culinary adventure from the first bite to the last.
Eff: Restores 22% of Max HP to the selected character and regenerates 470 HP every 5s for 30s.

Name: Flaming Red Bolognese
Desc: Bolognese covered with a meat sauce. The meaty, herby aroma really gets your appetite going.
Eff: Restores 20% of Max HP to the selected character and regenerates 390 HP every 5s for 30s.

Name: Suspicious Flaming Red Bolognese
Desc: Bolognese covered with a meat sauce. A bit chewy and annoyingly sticks to your teeth.
Eff: Restores 18% of Max HP to the selected character and regenerates 300 HP every 5s for 30s.

Name: Fruity Skewers
Desc: Kaeya's specialty. A chewy skewer with a rich sweet aftertaste. Wait... Is this really the smell of fruit?
Eff: Restores 16% of Max HP and an additional 1,350 HP to the selected character.

Name: Delicious Chicken-Mushroom Skewer
Desc: A skewer of mushrooms and poultry. All the best the wild has to offer are pierced on just one stick.
Eff: Restores 10% of Max HP and an additional 1,200 HP to the selected character.

Name: Chicken-Mushroom Skewer
Desc: A skewer of mushrooms and poultry. Fresh poultry is complimented by fragrant mushrooms. Don't be picky, chow down!
Eff: Restores 9% of Max HP and an additional 1,000 HP to the selected character.

Name: Suspicious Chicken-Mushroom Skewer
Desc: A skewer of mushrooms and poultry. At first glance it's hard to tell which is which.
Eff: Restores 8% of Max HP and an additional 800 HP to the selected character.

Name: Outrider's Champion Steak!
Desc: Amber's specialty. One side is obviously uncooked. The other side gives off a subtle scent of something burnt. Close your eyes and have a big mouthful, just to keep Amber happy if nothing else.
Eff: Revives a character and restores 10% of Max HP, then restores an additional 150 HP.

Name: Delicious Steak
Desc: A grilled steak. Juicy, flavorsome, fragrant steak. One bite and you feel yourself come alive.
Eff: Revives a character and restores 150 HP.

Name: Steak
Desc: A grilled steak. High heat has locked the juices in, giving one high expectations for when the meat is cut open.
Eff: Revives a character and restores 100 HP.

Name: Suspicious Steak
Desc: A grilled steak. Its color is a little bleak, almost as if it feels sorry for itself for being a sorry excuse for a steak.
Eff: Revives a character and restores 50 HP.

Name: Delicious Teyvat Fried Egg
Desc: An egg fried on one side. With a taste of the summer sun, it invigorates you from the first bite.
Eff: Revives a character and restores 150 HP.

Name: Teyvat Fried Egg
Desc: An egg fried on one side. The yolk flows out nicely when broken. So satisfying.
Eff: Revives a character and restores 100 HP.

Name: Suspicious Teyvat Fried Egg
Desc: An egg fried on one side. A bit hard in the middle. One can only hope it still has its nutrients.
Eff: Revives a character and restores 50 HP.

Name: Delicious Fisherman's Toast
Desc: Onion-covered toast. Exudes a wonderful aroma. Are the fish biting for the bait, or is it the toast they're after?
Eff: Increases all party members' DEF by 126 for 300s. In Co-Op Mode, this effect only applies to your own character(s).

Name: Fisherman's Toast
Desc: Onion-covered toast. A favorite amongst fishermen, they will stuff a bag with it and sit by the river all day.
Eff: Increases all party members' DEF by 107 for 300s. In Co-Op Mode, this effect only applies to your own character(s).

Name: Suspicious Fisherman's Toast
Desc: Onion-covered toast. Not quite cooked right. You'll notice its imperfection, even if you eat it while fishing.
Eff: Increases all party members' DEF by 88 for 300s. In Co-Op Mode, this effect only applies to your own character(s).

Name: Delicious Calla Lily Seafood Soup
Desc: A balanced combination of seafood. The crab, mint, and Calla Lily come together perfectly to dance on your tongue. It reminds you of playing barefoot by the lake in summer.
Eff: Increases all party members' DEF by 235 for 300s. In Co-Op Mode, this effect only applies to your own character(s).

Name: Delicious Fried Radish Balls
Desc: Fried Radish Balls. It's insane that something so delicious comes from plain old radishes! All who eat them will truly understand Liyue's culinary reputation.
Eff: Increases all party members' ATK by 95 for 300s. In Co-Op Mode, this effect only applies to your own character(s).

Name: Delicious Sticky Honey Roast
Desc: A meat dish in a sweet honey sauce. The warm honey draws out the flavor of the meat, creating a flavor explosion akin to bathing in the warm summer sun.
Eff: Decreases all party members' climbing and sprinting Stamina consumption by 25% for 900s. In Co-Op Mode, this effect only applies to your own character(s).

Name: Delicious Golden Crab
Desc: Crab meat that's been rolled in flour, deep fried, and then pan fried together with ginger and garlic. When you finally plate up, the crab appears to be lying on gold.

Name: Candlecap Mushroom
Desc: A fungus that grows on cliff faces or at the foot of mountains, and which shines like a little lamp. You can feel a hint of warmth when your hand draws close.
Eff: Restores 300 HP for the selected character.

Name: Bulle Fruit
Desc: A fruit that grows in warm and damp environments with ample sunlight. Inside this round and rotund fruit hides a sweet and refreshing surprise.
Eff: Restores 300 HP for the selected character.

Name: Scorched Starshroom
Desc: A fungus with a cap that resembles a five-pointed star. It seems to be a little singed.
Eff: Restores 1 HP for the selected character.

Name: Activated Starshroom
Desc: A fungus with a cap that resembles a five-pointed star. It seems to be bursting with vitality.
Eff: Restores 800 HP for the selected character.

Name: Starshroom
Desc: A fungus with a cap that resembles a five-pointed star. It is quite hardy indeed. Once it matures, the center of the cap will split open.
Eff: Restores 300 HP for the selected character.

Name: Sunsettia
Desc: A plump fruit, beautiful like the sunset, that is abundant across all of Teyvat. It has a curious, sweet aroma and is able to energize an individual.
Eff: Restores 300 HP for the selected character.

Name: Apple
Desc: Crisp and fragrant. Delicious raw or made into wine.
Eff: Restores 300 HP for the selected character.

Name: Spice
Desc: A seasoning with varied flavors. It is made from dried Harra Fruits and can enrich the taste of a dish. Therefore, Sumeru locals say, "Spice goes well with anything."

Name: Sausage
Desc: Finely minced meat wrapped in a skin. A staple of every meat lover's daily diet.

Name: Bacon
Desc: Smoked strips of pork. Crispy with a bit of fat, but not too greasy. Mmmmm... bacon.

Name: Cheese
Desc: Made from fermented milk. High in energy, it's used in a wide range of dishes.

Name: Jam
Desc: A gelatinous substance made from fruit and sugar. Even a little bit can easily wake up tired taste buds.

Name: Sugar
Desc: A seasoning derived from Sweet Flowers. Has the power to give both energy and happiness.

Name: Ham
Desc: Smoked leg meat. Even the thinnest slice is packed full of flavor.

Name: Butter
Desc: An extract from milk. With the appropriate application, it can bring rich aromas to even the most basic ingredients.

Name: Smoked Fowl
Desc: Fowl that has been smoked. The firmness of the meat gives new texture to dishes.

Name: Cream
Desc: A dairy product made from milk. An essential ingredient in making pastries.

Name: Flour
Desc: A powder ground from wheat. No matter what it goes into, it brings a sense of satisfaction to the diner.

Name: Crafted Items
Desc: Items produced through the Crafting System.

Name: Empowered Dragontooth
Desc:
A Dragontooth that has absorbed vitality and now exudes a warmth that makes one uneasy. Once upon a time, a dragon fell to ruin in a silver valley, painting the bone-white snow an ominous crimson. This crimson symbolizes the might of this dragon.
This Dragontooth wrapped in that crimson may yet be forged into a deadly weapon...

Name: Strange Tooth
Desc: A Dragontooth you picked up in Dragonspine. Perhaps someone would know something more about it...

Name: Fate's Yearning
Desc:
Silk Flowers from which perfume used in the Rite of Parting is made.
In the past, this strain would grow among cloud-ringed peaks. It is a reclusive species, and has a subtle yet enduring scent.

Name: Valley Weaver
Desc:
Silk Flowers from which perfume used in the Rite of Parting is made.
This variety originally grew in dark, damp locations. It is known for its profusion of petals, densely packed stamens, and powerful scent.

Name: Golden House Maiden
Desc:
Silk Flowers from which perfume used in the Rite of Parting is made.
This species originally grew under complex hydrological conditions. Its foliage is abundant, its leaves are evergreen, and its stamen is as fair as a Golden House Maiden.

Name: Fermented Juice
Desc: A fermented juice with a unique fruity scent. It is often used as a marinade.
Src: Sold at general goods shops in Fontaine

Name: Coffee Beans
Desc: A common fruit in Teyvat with a special aroma. It can be used to make beverages after being ground.

Name: Mysterious Meat
Desc: A fresh chunk of meat that seems to be radiating an enigmatic aura. Wonder what it'll taste like?

Name: Glabrous Beans
Desc: A common legume in Teyvat with a light aroma. It can be prepared in a variety of ways, and is thus widely accepted by people all over the world.
Src: Sold at general goods shops in Fontaine
Sold at general goods shops in Natlan

Name: Eel Meat
Desc: The fresh meat of an Unagi/Eel. If handled properly, it can be used to make fresh, lovely food.

Name: Chilled Meat
Desc:
Rare, fresh meat.
This species of boar is recorded to have gone extinct several hundred years ago and has been preserved by the extreme temperatures on Dragonspine. For the gourmets of Teyvat, this is an ingredient of unspeakable sacrosanctness.

Name: Shrimp Meat
Desc: A whole piece of deep sea shrimp meat, full of nutrients and bursting with delicious flavor.
Src: Sold at general goods shops in Liyue
Sold at general goods shops in Inazuma
Sold at general goods shops in Sumeru

Name: Rice
Desc: A grain crop commonly found in Teyvat. People of all walks of life enjoy its distinct grainy texture. As the saying goes, "The same kind of rice can feed one hundred kinds of people."
Src: Sold at general goods shops in Liyue
Sold at general goods shops in Inazuma
Sold at general goods shops in Sumeru

Name: Bamboo Shoot
Desc: A fresh young bamboo shoot, straight out of the ground. It is a delicious cooking ingredient with an exotic aroma, found exclusively in bamboo-growing regions.
Src: Recommendation: Found in the bamboo forest near Qingce Village

Name: Loach Pearl
Desc:
A shiny pearl spat out by a loach that has mystical medicinal properties.
Minerals and elemental particles ingested by the loach condense into these mildly magical beads. When threatened, the loach spits them out to confuse predators and escape with its life.

Name: Almond
Desc: A seed with a peculiar fragrance that gives food a refreshing taste.
Src: Sold at general goods shops in Liyue
Sold at general goods shops in Fontaine

Name: Tofu
Desc: Freshly made bean product that has a silky-smooth tender texture.
Src: Sold at general goods shops in Liyue
Sold at general goods shops in Inazuma
Sold at general goods shops in Sumeru

Name: Fowl (S)
Desc: A fresh chunk of fowl. Handled properly, it can make a hearty meal.

Name: Raw Meat (S)
Desc: A fresh chunk of meat. Handled properly, it can be used to make delicious food.

Name: Crystal Core
Desc: The core of a crystal butterfly. It absorbs elemental energy that has escaped into the atmosphere.

Name: Fish
Desc: A fresh fillet of fish. Handled properly, it can make a rich dish. Fish are the life and soul of the rivers, lakes, and seas.

Name: Lizard Tail
Desc: A lizard tail that curled up after losing its owner. Very bitter, but has skin hardening properties.

Name: Luminescent Spine
Desc: The light-emitting part of a firefly. Used for courtship, and in medicine to help recover strength.

Name: Frog
Desc: Common frog found in moist environments. Full of energy, they secrete a substance that will keep you full of vitality.
Src: Found near bodies of fresh water

Name: Potato
Desc: A chunky vegetable. A gift from the earth that you never tire of with its multitude of cooking methods.

Name: Tomato
Desc: A bright red ingredient that gives a tangy kick. Yes, the "fruit or vegetable" debate is still going...

Name: Milk
Desc: Sweet and fragrant cow's milk. Don't waste a single drop, not even that one rolling down your chin.

Name: Pepper
Desc: Peppery. Cuts through oily flavors and excites the taste buds. Goes best on meat.

Name: Onion
Desc: A spherical vegetable. As vengeance for cutting it, it will make you cry, no matter how brave you are.

Name: Salt
Desc: A savory seasoning. A precise but adequate amount will elevate the quality of the cuisine. It is said that someone once lived who implored his descendants to "Be unto this world as salt is unto rocks."

Name: Crab Roe
Desc: A delicacy specific to female crabs. A rare and prized ingredient that isn't quite to everyone's taste.

Name: Crab
Desc: A shelled creature that lives near the ocean. Its flaky, delicious meat can easily be made into tasty dishes.
Src: Found near lakes, river banks, and beaches

Name: Butterfly Wings
Desc: Brightly colored wings. The powder that falls from them shimmers a little. Perhaps this is what allows them to fly?

Name: Fowl
Desc:
A fresh chunk of fowl. Handled properly, it can make a hearty meal.
Unlike the land-dwelling creatures of the world, birds belong to the skies, and spend the majority of the time in flight. Birds, therefore, clock up a high amount of physical activity over their lives, which gives their meat a wholly different texture from that of land animals.

Name: Matsutake
Desc: A rare fungus that generally grows on or near pine trees. Its delicate aroma gives away its location.

Name: Bird Egg
Desc: An incredibly versatile ingredient that can supply all of your daily protein needs.

Name: Raw Meat
Desc:
A fresh chunk of meat. Handled properly, it can be used to make delicious food.
All kinds of creatures roam the vast lands of Teyvat, some of which have become sources of nutrition for humans. It is said that in the distant past, there existed a species of animal so large that it could feed an entire city for a year.

Name: Cor Lapis
Desc: A precious crystal of condensed pure Geo element that usually grows along with other minerals. It's also commonly called "Cor Petrae."

Name: Dandelion Seed
Desc: A tiny seed that rides on the wind. Even without its feathered wings, it still holds the hope from afar within. In a sense, the dandelion represents the romantic spirit of love and freedom. In the land of the wind, where dandelions are found in abundance, people use dandelions in wine making. Experts in local folklore believe that in ancient times, wine brewed from dandelions had a strong symbolic meaning.

Name: Calla Lily
Desc: A flower that grows near water sources. When cooked, the petals have a chunky texture, yet are sweet and a little bitter. Modern medicine recognizes Calla Lily's antidotal properties, but its astringent flavor is repulsive to many people.

Name: Small Lamp Grass
Desc: A wild grass that emits light at night. Used in cooking to enhance other flavors. Just as the subtle fragrance of wild flowers will not distract a focused person, Small Lamp Grass' delicate glow will not attract their attention either, even at night.
Src: Recommendation: Found in the Whispering Woods

Name: Electro Crystal
Desc: A power-rich crystal that draws electricity from the air around it. Holding it makes your hand a little numb. With the right equipment, maybe it's possible to harness the Electro energy contained within?

Name: Flaming Flower Stamen
Desc: The stamen of a fiercely burning flower. Even after being extinguished, it still emits heat. It is said that this plant slowly develops intelligence and unique behaviors as it accumulates elemental energy.
Src: Recommendation: Found at the Thousand Winds Temple

Name: Mist Flower Corolla
Desc: A flower bud encased in solid ice. Even after being picked the flower continues to emit cold. A popular work of fiction tells of a fox becoming trapped in ice from a Mist Flower and being unable to extricate itself. For small creatures with limited strength, it is a very dangerous plant indeed.

Name: Berry
Desc: Small, brightly-colored fruit. They can be found everywhere, and the taste of them wipes the fatigue of a long journey away.

Name: Violetgrass
Desc: A small flower with strong vitality. It is said that its downward-blooming flower keeps its fragrance from dissipating.

Name: Starconch
Desc: Empty seashells brought ashore by the tides. Hold one close to your ear, and hear the longing calls of the sea.
Src: Found on the beaches of Liyue

Name: Horsetail
Desc: A purple plant that sometimes grows amidst Silvergrass but grows taller, straighter, and plumper — like an aristocrat among the paupers.
Src: Found in patches of Silvergrass and wetlands

Name: Qingxin
Desc: A translucent white flower that only grows on the highest stone peaks. It eschews the warmth and moisture of the plains to gaze out afar from the solitary mountaintops.
Src: Recommendation: Found in Guyun Stone Forest

Name: Glaze Lily
Desc: An extremely ancient flower, said to have once been a common sight in Liyue. It transforms the memories of the land into its fragrance during florescence. Legend has it that the flower will open at the sound of pure, beautiful music, and that there was once one who loved this flower more than any other. Now, however, the sight of a Glaze Lily in full bloom out in the wild is a rare one indeed.
Src: Recommendation: Found in Yujing Terrace, Liyue Harbor

Name: Silk Flower
Desc: A crimson flower that blooms like the rainbow clouds in Liyue. It can be made into silky-smooth fabric. Liyue's Feiyun Commerce Guild is a giant in silk and textile manufacturing. Legend has it that Feiyun Commerce Guild has a secret Silk Flower nursery somewhere in the mainland. Nobody in the industry can rival their yield and texture.
Src: Found near Yujing Terrace, Liyue Harbor

Name: Noctilucous Jade
Desc: A rare mineral that glimmers in the dark. It's said to be a mutated gemstone condensed from the flourishing elements of the world.

Name: Jueyun Chili
Desc:
A spicy plant native to Liyue. Merely smelling it makes one hot and thirsty. Despite "Jueyun" being a part of its name, it does not usually grow in Jueyun Karst.
The name seems to originate from its spiciness, which makes people want to run to the highest peaks of Jueyun and cool their mouths with chilly air.

Name: Lotus Head
Desc: An aquatic plant native to Liyue that grows and blooms in pairs. One is fragrant, and the other bitter. It's said to make a good herbal medicine.
Src: Found near lakes and river banks

Name: Philanemo Mushroom
Desc: A fungus that grows in the warm caress of the wind. It is as everlasting as the wind, nourishing life.
Src: Found under the eaves of houses

Name: Windwheel Aster
Desc: A plant that adores the wind. To the proud children of the wind, or the citizens of Mondstadt, the Windwheel Asters are "the visible winds."
Src: Found near the Statue of The Seven at Windrise

Name: Cecilia
Desc: A beautiful flower with a name that suits its appearance. It only grows where harsh winds blow, and is just as intangible as the true heart of an unbound soul.

Name: Valberry
Desc: A plump and translucent berry that has a fragrant smell and a sweet, refreshing taste. In the past, the storm watchers' only solace was the sweetness of this fruit and hope for the city's peace.

Name: Wolfhook
Desc: A berry with thorns that often gets attached to a wolf's pelt. When you look at it, you can almost hear the echoing cries of the wolves in the woods. Wolfhook has medicinal properties useful in treating minor illnesses. Although, in its original form, it can also harm careless people or animals...

Name: Pinecone
Desc: Filled with oil-rich seeds. Certainly won't be growing into a tree from inside a squirrel's stomach.

Name: Silver Lotus
Desc: A rare plant that grows on steep cliffs with nobility. Shines magnificently in the night.

Name: Cabbage
Desc: A layered, leafy vegetable. Said to have originally been an ornamental plant, it certainly looks great in the pot.

Name: Wheat
Desc: Golden, sun-kissed tassels. Needs to be ground down to flour for further use.

Name: Mint
Desc: A refreshingly cool ingredient. The cool, fresh flavor can cut through the heat of many dishes. Mint is readily available throughout the land and is known for its exuberant vitality.

Name: Snapdragon
Desc: Can be eaten once cooked. As a spice, it can bring wonderful flavor to dishes.
Src: Found near lakes and river banks

Name: Radish
Desc: Rich in fiber and nutrients. Easy to grow and harvest.

Name: Carrot
Desc: A healthy and nutritious vegetable that is crunchy and sweet to the taste. Easy to grow and harvest.

Name: Sweet Flower
Desc: Particularly fragrant flowers. They can be easily located, even in the dark, thanks to their sweet scent. Commonly used in Teyvat to make sugar.

Name: Mushroom
Desc: Hardy common fungi. Can grow anywhere with the right amount of shade and moisture.

Name: Sunsettia
Desc: A plump fruit, beautiful like the sunset, that is abundant across all of Teyvat. It has a curious, sweet aroma and is able to energize an individual.

Name: Apple
Desc: Crisp and fragrant. Delicious raw or fermented into wine. Can be also made into a refreshing alcohol-free beverage.

Name: Echo: Lonesome Transcendence
Desc: Shenhe's Envisaged Echo. "From the world she seems apart, but there are those who know her heart."

Name: Echo: Plane of Euthymia
Desc: Raiden Shogun's Envisaged Echo. "The drawn bow is like the quartered moon, and studying the blade is like a circle of transparent jade. Now, the truth of jade lies beyond reach, my only companion the moonlit shades."

Name: Echo: Flame-Mane
Desc: Dehya's Envisaged Echo. "The eyes of a vulture, the spirit of a lion, an unbridled daughter of the desert."

Name: Echo: Windborne Bard
Desc: Venti's Envisaged Echo. "As free as the wind, I shall sing now the praises of things beauteous and true."

Name: Echo: Scarlet Leaves Pursue Wild Waves
Desc: Kaedehara Kazuha's Envisaged Echo. "Flowers and birds are a dear pleasure to one winding under the moonlight."

Name: Echo: Plenilune Gaze
Desc: Ganyu's Envisaged Echo. "Proceed with elegance, avoid certain peril."

Name: Echo: Driving Thunder
Desc: Keqing's Envisaged Echo. "Swift thunder questioned new boughs last night, this morn the rainbow drove clouds to flight."

Name: Echo: Vago Mundo
Desc: Zhongli's Envisaged Echo. "Waste not the mountain spring, for no order governs wandering for leisure."

Name: Echo: Dark Side of Dawn
Desc: Diluc's Envisaged Echo. The night owl's pinions ignite, that a corner of the darkness may have light.

Name: Echo: Cat Upon the Eaves
Desc: Kirara's Envisaged Echo. Wherever cat claws nimbly tread, blooming flowers there shall spread.

Name: Echo: Eclipsing Star
Desc: Ningguang's Envisaged Echo is shaped like gilded ginkgo leaves, noble and elegant.

Name: Echo: Icy Resurrection
Desc: Qiqi's Envisaged Echo. The Heralds of Frost often come to visit and do calisthenic exercises together with her.

Name: Echo: Dandelion Knight
Desc: Jean's Envisaged Echo flutters like dandelions in the wind, swirling about her, accompanying her on her resolute journey.

Name: Till We Meet Again
Desc: Complete "In the Footsteps of the Chosen of Dragons" to unlock

Name: Silent Reverie Across Time
Desc: Complete "The Lost Holy City and the Millennium Seeker" to unlock

Name: Last Hero of Cinder City
Desc: Complete "Lost Traveler in the Ashen Realm" to unlock

Name: Your Saurian companion!
Desc: Complete "Between Pledge and Forgettance" to unlock

Name: Monsieur Os
Desc: Complete "Canticles of Harmony" to unlock

Name: Rainjade Oblation
Desc: Complete "Chenyu's Blessings of Sunken Jade" to unlock

Name: Pahsiv!
Desc: Complete "The Wild Fairy of Erinnyes" to unlock

Name: The Formless Society
Desc: Complete "In the Wake of Narcissus" to unlock

Name: Crest of Artifice
Desc: Complete "Fontaine Research Institute Chronicles" to unlock

Name: Caterpillar
Desc: Complete "Unfinished Comedy" to unlock

Name: Ann & Mary-Ann
Desc: Complete "Ann of the Narzissenkreuz" to unlock

Name: Nice to Meet You
Desc: Complete the "Ancient Colors" to unlock

Name: Bloomguard: Sorush
Desc: Complete "Khvarena of Good and Evil" to unlock

Name: Mother of the Jinn
Desc: Complete "The Dirge of Bilqis" to unlock

Name: Jeht and Benben
Desc: Complete "Golden Slumber" to unlock

Name: Arama
Desc: Complete "Aranyaka" to unlock

Name: Zhiqiong's Signature
Desc: Complete "The Chasm Delvers" to unlock

Name: Dainichi Mikoshi
Desc: Complete "From Dusk to Dawn in Byakuyakoku" to unlock

Name: The Thunderbird and the Boy
Desc: Complete "Through the Mists" to unlock

Name: "Provisional Head Priestess of the Asase Shrine"
Desc: Complete "Seirai Stormchasers" to unlock

Name: Hanachirusato's Mask
Desc: Complete "Sacred Sakura Cleansing Ritual" to unlock

Name: "Lingering Euphonia"
Desc:
A guitar that Skirk made based on the instruments of her homeland.
The guitar has a unique charm when played. Its ancient melody seems to hum of a history that nobody recalls.

Name: Neo Terminal: Floating Leaf Model
Desc:
A Neo Akasha Terminal mechanism based on an unknown creature, created by a deity who commands all wisdom.
Its creator ingeniously programmed an auto-follow protocol, intending for it to provide aid to its master anywhere, anytime.
In addition, it also comes with the latest timekeeping function, as if to remind its master of their daily agenda.

Name: Inscribed Mirror
Desc: A mirror-type gadget made by the Amurta researcher Lamiya. It can be linked to the adopted animals' devices, which will reflect the animals' points of view in the mirror.

Name: Ukulele
Desc:
A traditional instrument from Natlan that can be used in performances.
A small, four-stringed lute shaped similarly to — and which plays like — a guitar, though its fret count and tuning differ. Thanks to the material the strings are made of, it sounds clear and bright, yet soft, soothing the hearts of those who hear it.

Name: Djem Djem Drum
Desc:
A traditional instrument from Natlan that can be used in performances.
A percussion instrument with a skin drumhead that can be played with one's bare hands. Tuned using ropes, it has a unique sound that, in skilled hands, can add a rich rhythm to any song.

Name: Repertoire of Myriad Melodies
Desc:
A collection of sheet music given to you by Sansa the bard. It contains musical scores and performance insights gathered from various nations, penned in such detail as to rival a musical encyclopedia.
With such a collection at their disposal, a musician could play many enchanting melodies indeed...

Name: Artifact Transmuter
Desc:
·Consume Sanctifying Elixir to generate Artifacts through the process of Definition, or consume Artifacts to obtain Sanctifying Elixir through the process of Extraction.
·During each cycle, there is a limit on both the amount of Sanctifying Elixir that can be extracted and the number of times that Artifacts of each Set can be defined.

Artifacts draw their power from stories. This explains how it is possible to attempt to create Artifacts through sacred writings. Legend tells of an instance where seventy sages independently produced identical translations of the same source text; and thus, the original text was considered to be sacred. A person has only to place their hand on this machine and the story behind the Artifact will naturally flow out of it.

Name: Paimon's Kamera
Desc: A convenient gadget that records and saves images when used, this one belongs to Paimon. Back when you bought it, you haggled with the seller for ages before finally scoring a bargain on this custom Kamera, which Paimon keeps with great care. You recall that the seller included a thick photo album along with the Kamera too, but you've barely seen her take it out. Just what kind of photos has she taken with that Kamera of hers?

Name: Graffiti Kamera
Desc: A "Graffiti Alliance" Kamera provided by "Dopey Dazzler." Functionally, it isn't much different from a standard Kamera. However, it's said that it can capture and record specific scenes and objects, serving as a repository for inspiration and source material for graffiti artists...

Name: Kaboom Box
Desc:
A mechanism that continually absorbs the force it receives.
Apparently, when the power within reaches bursting point, it will explode in a dazzling display of fireworks. But the amount of force needed to trigger this explosion seems to vary each time... So why not take turns attacking it with your friends? They say that whoever makes it go "kaboom" will have extraordinarily good luck for the rest of the day.

Name: Firstborn Firesprite
Desc:
A tiny lifeform that emerged from a flame within a shell.
There is something quite endearing about its over-reliance on the shell it found protecting it at the moment it gained its sentience — perhaps it feels secure in this closed-up world. After all, when its eggshell is completely enclosed, it reigns supreme in its own little universe.
It is said that in ancient times, the Primal Fire burned with a similar life force.

Name: Pyro Treasure Compass
Desc: A handy tool used to locate nearby chests and relevant clues. In the land of perpetual conflict, there is a simple rule when it comes to finding treasure: Finders, keepers.

Name: Pyroculus Resonance Stone
Desc:
A stone that can be used in Natlan to search for nearby Pyroculi.
During its crafting, adjustments were made to imbue it with characteristics resembling those of the Pyro Statues of The Seven, allowing one to sense the blazing power of the Pyroculi through it.
By sacrificing oneself, the Pyroculi can be returned to the statue, reuniting the scattered flames. Perhaps the Resonance Stone deems this sacrifice to be worth it.

Name: Asagiri's Dedicated Fontaine Kamera
Desc:
A Kamera you obtained from Asagiri. Use it to help her complete her work of gathering inspiration on her trip to Fontaine.
The Kamera is well-maintained, clearly showing that this artist paid as much attention to this key tool as she does her paints and brushes...

Name: "Yelena"
Desc:
A sample of the perfume Emilie made herself. It is based on the legendary "Auguste" fragrance chronicled in Fontaine's histories.
Tilt the bottle toward the sunlight and you will see this flowing line of graceful text: "Forget the past, and keep on living."

Name: Joyous Letters
Desc:
Letter paper that radiates a magical glow, and a masterfully crafted quill. With this in hand, elegant, ebullient words shall flow across the page of their own accord, writing detailed descriptions of certain objects' locations, and seemingly hinting at the location of treasure...
After using this item, you can detect all "Excerpts of Bliss" within Simulanka.

Name: Jocund Letters
Desc:
Letter paper emanating a faint magical glow, and a finely crafted quill. With this in hand, elegant, ebullient words shall flow across the page of their own accord, writing detailed descriptions of certain objects' locations, and seemingly hinting at the location of treasure...
After using this item, you can detect "Excerpts of Bliss" within a certain AoE inside Simulanka.

Name: "Fateometer"
Desc:
A deceptively grandiose-looking card box that is actually quite simple. The number drawn seems to indicate a certain direction of fate, or perhaps the success or failure of a certain choice...
"As long as you believe in your bond with the cards, the numbers shown will show your fate." — Since Lyney said that, let's just tentatively take his word with a shaker of salt.

Name: Nightwind Horn
Desc:
This exquisite horn is a Fontainian instrument that can be used in performances, and was a gift from Dvorak to you.
They say the tones of the horn are both rich and mellow as well as gentle, like a gentle evening breeze blowing among a thicket of trees. So, Fontainian composers often use horns to vividly bring the imagery of hunters and forests to life. Without a doubt, this instrument is eminently suited to a musical gala celebrating "life."

Name: Mini Seelie: Brilliance
Desc:
A memento from Lost Riches. Equip the Seelie to gain its company.
A mini Seelie with brilliant colors, it can move freely underwater.

Name: Treasure-Seeking Seelie
Desc: A Treasure-Seeking Seelie obtained from Ulman. It is said that it can move freely underwater, even though it doesn't look very energetic right now...

Name: Image Sampling Kamera
Desc: A Kamera specially modified by Lepine-Pauline for the profound discipline of "Graph Adversarial Technology." It is unknown just what kind of complex and expensive components are installed inside, but it seems to be able to capture the photograph subject's particular structure, profile, and coloration...

Name: "Special Analysis Zoom Lens"
Desc:
A new type of Kamera accessory developed to enhance image recognition capabilities.
After equipping this accessory, a normal Kamera can quickly adjust its focus, allowing it to capture images of your travels so you can record precious memories at a moment's notice.

Name: Portable Aerodynamic Gelatinous Bubble Generator
Desc:
A mechanism that can be used to create large amounts of colloid bubbles.

Givalois, a researcher from the Fontaine Research Institute, developed this prototype.
The original purpose was to create a large generator of gelatinous bubbles. Just as the project aimed to do, the bubbles so produced could carry some amount of water within them, and move or hover stably in the air, potentially achieving the aim of being able to quickly transport water resources.
However, as they were never able to find a material to make gelatinous bubbles of this type, the project stalled at the prototype stage.
But it is said the researcher Givalois's children loved this prototype bubble machine, so perhaps it would be possible to sell it as a toy?

"This machine is a product of Daddy's research, and it's called the Portable Aerodynamic Gelatinous Bubble Generator..."
"Bubbles! So pretty! Daddy, you're amazing!"

Name: Bresson's Special Kamera
Desc: A Kamera specially modified by Bresson. It was manufactured with the best materials available, and has excellent performance.

Name: Wind-Powered Wind Generator
Desc:
A wind generating device developed by Refait, senior researcher from Fontaine Research Institute of Kinetic Energy Engineering.
After being activated, this device can provide a strong lifting force for the Wind Glider user.
However, due to design limitations, the device requires utilizing significant wind power to activate. The wind energy required is approximately equal to that produced by the working Wind Glider.
"Umm... So you mean I can only activate this device when I'm already using the Wind Glider."
"But the only reason I even want to activate it is to give my Wind Glider a push!"

Name: Crystalfly Trap
Desc:
A Crystalfly Trap, developed by a senior researcher named Fawitzki from Fontaine Research Institute of Kinetic Energy Engineering.
After being properly deployed and inserting the required materials, this device will start working and lure Crystalflies inside.
Fawitzki once led research on "Low-Temperature Lighting Devices," which required a large amount of Crystal Cores as research materials, which led to the development of the Crystalfly Trap.
However, the project was suspended for various reasons.
"We are here to commemorate the diligent Mr. Fawitzki. We sincerely hope that there are those who will carry on his research. The Institute will provide maximum support in any areas deemed appropriate."

Name: Hydro Treasure Compass
Desc:
A compass that can be used in Fontaine to search for nearby treasure and relevant clues.
These chests scattered across Fontaine are not the lawful property of any individual or organization. In most circumstances, it is legal to claim the contents found within.

Name: Hydroculus Resonance Stone
Desc:
A talisman that can be used in Fontaine to search for nearby Hydroculi.
A curious talisman that possesses similar properties to the Hydro Statues of The Seven. It seems to be able to detect the Elemental Flow of Hydroculi.
Oculi are by nature scattered pieces of power belonging to the Statues of The Seven. Returning them to the Statues is therefore the reasonable, right, and lawful thing to do.

Name: Inscribed Mirror
Desc: A mirror-type gadget made by the Amurta researcher Lamiya. It can be linked to the animals' devices, which will reflect the animals' points of view in the mirror.

Name: Itty Bitty Octobaby
Desc:
A type of tiny octopus that normally lives in the depths of the ocean.
Perhaps out of an overabundance of curiosity, or a desire to travel, it begins to cruise throughout the seas while still extremely young. If it sees a creature it likes, it will follow it everywhere.
But who knows what it will be like when it grows up...

Name: Felicitous Joyspar
Desc:
A marvelous crystal within which radiance flows like a river. It seems to be able to sense joyous emotions in a vast area and lead people in the corresponding direction.
Use this to find all Joyeux Vouchers within the Veluriyam Mirage.

Name: Flowing Joyspar
Desc:
A marvelous crystal with spots of radiance that seems to be able to sense joyous emotions in a certain radius around it and lead people in the corresponding direction.
Use this to find Joyeux Vouchers in a set AoE.

Name: Search Compass
Desc: A "Search Compass" made to find relic replicas. As this device was adapted from one used to survey elemental energies, the localized elements present might disrupt its attempts to scan for those replicas...

Name: Sorush
Desc:
A Pari born in the Vourukasha Oasis, Sorush is a Bloomguard acknowledged by the Khvarena.
Having formed a connection with one whom she trusts, Sorush now traverses the land blessed by Khvarena alongside her Yasnapati...

Name: Festive Drum
Desc:
A musical instrument that can be used in performances.
A drum with a clear sound and unique design. It has an exquisite exterior and features intricate craftsmanship. High-quality materials have been used in its construction, with a view toward sound quality during performances, intonation and long-term wear and tear.
It is said that this small drum combines an Inazuman traditional instrument with some quirks of drums from other nations. When it plays certain tunes, it can even bring people good luck...

Name: Windblume Kamera
Desc: The Kamera you borrowed from Fassben. Be careful when using it. You don't want to break it, now...

Name: Sorush
Desc:
As one of the Pari, the defenders of the land, Sorush aspires to become a Bloomguard who shall quell calamity.
Having formed a connection with one whom she trusts, Sorush now traverses the defiled land alongside her Yasnapati...

Name: Wilderness Compass
Desc: A special compass obtained from the Adventurers' Guild. According to certain rumors, it might just offer you a sprinkle of extra luck...

Name: Cloud Retainer's Damasked Device
Desc:
Made from stacked paper, this lightweight device has the appearance of a bird, and fittingly, was given to you by Cloud Retainer.
While it may be called a "device," you cannot see any traditional mechanical components here — well, not from the outside, anyway.
It seems that this adeptus' skills as a mechanist have improved even further...

Name: Wisdom Orb
Desc: A crucial item provided by the organizer of the Nilotpala Cup Beast Tamers Tournament. Use it to capture, accommodate, and command intelligent Fungi. Word has it that it was invented by a researcher named Kautilya. Only those who can wield this item skillfully are qualified to participate in the Nilotpala Cup Beast Tamers Tournament. That said, you cannot help but feel that some of this item's functions create a strong sense of déjà vu...

Name: Jinni in the Magic Bottle — Liloupar
Desc:
Liloupar, the great Jinni born of the water lilies, had her soul fragmented by an ancient punishment, and was sealed within a transparent magical bottle...
In the songs of the desert people, she once laid down green oases and lapis lazuli canals in Gurabad, and in turn, was also the mourning harbinger of that city's doom... Hope and omen, thus weaved together, formed her legend.
And today, she seems to have found a new master...

Name: "Kusava"
Desc:
Equip it to utilize the power of Aranara.
"Fatty fruit, bitter fruit."
A temporary home for Aranara memories. Kusava makes Aranara strong.
Now inside it are stored the cherished memories of Aranakin, Aragaru, and Aranaga. The power within is ready to be unleashed at any minute for the sake of beloved friends.

Name: "Bubbly Kamera"
Desc:
When used, this useful gadget can save and store the scenery before it and add a special color tone to it.
A strange device of unknown origin. The photos it takes have a peculiar effect. Who would've thought that a machine with no water inside could produce photos with jovial bubbles in them that lend them a sense of fantasy?
A certain Cavalry Captain once described this machine as being able to "capture people's desire for cool and refreshing days."

Name: Jumpy Dumpty Party Popper
Desc:
A party popper that, when used, unleashes streamers and confetti.
"Jumpy Dumpty is Klee's good friend and fish blasting companion! But if Klee brings Jumpy Dumpty to the festival, Master Jean will be angry... Don't you worry, though! Jumpy Dumpty has gained a new ability with Albedo's help! Just pull on its tail, and beautiful colored strips will come flying out!"

Name: Vintage Lyre
Desc:
A vintage lyre borrowed from Amadhiah in Vimara Village. Mondstadt has a long-standing tradition of poetry and song. Bards from there tend to address their instruments as "Friend" or "Partner." Thus, one of them trusting Amadhiah with the instrument was nothing less than a gesture of intimacy and trust, and its passage into your hands must also be a gesture of faith and acknowledgment.
As Amadhiah puts it, the person who originally gave him this lyre has already disappeared into the forest.

Name: Fishing Line Stabilizer
Desc:
A self-adaptive tension stabilizer that can be installed on a fishing rod to facilitate fishing. The device can automatically detect and record how hard different fish struggle. The more data it collects, the better the stabilizer works.

The device's prototype was the pointless invention of a Fontaine inventor that drew little interest for the longest time until the Fontaine Fishing Association discovered it and modified the product into the fishing line stabilizer used today. When the device first came out, it was most warmly received by the Association members, and now it has gradually been promoted in other regions.
It is an exceptionally hot commodity in the Snezhnayan market. Word has it that one of the Lord Harbingers is particularly fond of the product, which explains the hype.

Name: Banu's Wisdom
Desc:
In some cosmological settings, this is a staff filled with mystical power. It can resonate with the Future Stars and show the way to them.
Of course, in some other settings, it might be an object kept in storage by an organization known as the Akademiya, and perhaps its recorded name might even be Ayesha's Chaos Prospector. There is a thin layer of dust over this object due to a long period of disuse.

Name: Exquisite Kamera
Desc:
A Kamera that Razi borrowed from Lord Sangemah Bay. It will come in handy when you take photos of beautiful scenery, look for inspiration in the wilderness, or wish to keep festive memories!
This Kamera is adorned with metal decorations and thus looks a lot more expensive than regular Kameras. Be careful with it!
According to the leasing agreement, it can only be used within Sumeru's borders.

Name: Mini Seelie: Moss
Desc:
A memento from the Lost Riches event. Equip it to obtain a mini Seelie companion.
A miniature green Seelie. It becomes most happy indeed when it gets close to a tree.

Name: Treasure-Seeking Seelie
Desc: The "Treasure-Seeking Seelie" you got from Ulman. It doesn't look that energetic...

Name: "The Boon of the Elder Tree"
Desc:
Talismans of this kind are often seen in the forests in Sumeru. They possess the ability to gather the power of grass and trees.
To prevent the erosion of the forest and, in darker times, to resist the invasion of vicious monsters, trees and vines would form impregnable shelters together.
The Lord of Verdure would grant these talismans to people, giving them unfettered access to walk amidst the forest under the guidance of streams and moonlight.
One day, the labyrinth disappeared, and the forest lost its intellect.
Even so, the people of Sumeru take these talismans as symbols of the forest's protection — and the forest answers the request of such talismans and gives its power.

Name: Dendro Treasure Compass
Desc:
A handy tool used to locate nearby chests and relevant clues. For some people, the significance of life lies in exploration and discovery. Upon reaching each destination, there is always bountiful treasure awaiting.
Travelers on the road will one day find their destiny, and the experiences, stories, and riches that they leave behind will become riches that those who come after will seek.

Name: Dendroculus Resonance Stone
Desc:
A stone that can be used in Sumeru to search for nearby Dendroculi.
A curious amulet of a similar nature to the Dendro Statues of The Seven. By the same token, it is drawn to Dendroculi.
In the world, there are grass and trees, vines and flowers — living beings of Dendro Element that abound in diverse shapes and forms. Though differing in appearance and various other aspects, they were born from the same land and will return to the same land.

Name: Casket of Tomes
Desc:
A box for cards released by the Genius Invokation TCG Society. Only beginners who have learned the basic rules and are verified as players can collect one.
They say that these boxes were made by researchers from the Sumeru Akademiya, and that they feature a special mechanism that can be used to detect nearby people who also possess Caskets of Tomes.
Use this function to engage in more matches against nearby players!

Name: "Kusava"
Desc:
Equip it to utilize the power of Aranara.
"Fatty fruit, bitter fruit."
A temporary home for Aranara memories. Kusava makes Aranara strong.

Name: Material Collector
Desc: A collection device created by Bertrand, a manufacturer of machines. It can sequentially collect materials required for creating other products. When hooked up to the Great Machine, it will pour the source materials into the latter and start the process of creating robotic furnishings.

Name: Arataki's Great and Glorious Drum
Desc:
A musical instrument that can be used in performances.
A small drum that Itto gave you. He bought it from an outlander merchant, and while it does look quite normal, it is said to be a relic left behind by an ancient and powerful onmyouji who used it to drive out calamity and pray for blessings.
It would cost an ordinary person a large sum if they were to wish to possess this, but the price may be negotiated if one has some connection to the drum.
And wouldn't you know it? An 8,000,000 Mora treasure was eventually purchased for 80,000. What a steal for Itto, eh?

Name: Bokuso Box
Desc:
Use this to clear a certain area in Enkanomiya of the darkness' influence.
The name "Bokuso" is formed from "boku," meaning "to draw near to what is good," and "so," meaning "to shun that which is tainted."

Name: Lumenstone Adjuvant
Desc:
A special ore from The Chasm that shines brightly in special environments.
It has many similarities to the Glazed Sand Crystal that may only be found within The Chasm.
That neither Lumenstone or Glaze Sand Crystal have never been found outside The Chasm may have an intimate relationship with the ley lines in that area.
May it be like a small sun in your palm, bringing light and comfort to your dark path.

Name: Launch Tube
Desc: A special device created by the artisan Pengyi. It comes with functions that allow for the creation and automated launch of fireworks. In the hands of someone creative, it will surely see great use in the creation of unique and radiant fireworks shows.

Name: Ubiquity Net
Desc: A friend of Sango's used Kamuna Onmyoudou in a fit of inspiration to create this convenient little gadget. It is not powerful enough to capture criminals, but with a little aim, capturing little animals should be a cinch.

Name: Shiki Koshou
Desc: A gift from Shiki Taishou — a replica that possesses sentience. With the departure of Kamuna Harunosuke, the replicas scattered throughout the Mystic Onmyou Chamber would deteriorate over time, becoming nothing but fragments of memories and Charm Magic. However, it is precisely because this is so that "Shiki Koshou" is most rare and valuable indeed. It may well be the last remaining replica that can maintain constant remote contact with Shiki Taishou as a mark of the latter's deep attachment to his friends.

Name: Floral Zither
Desc:
A musical instrument that can be used in performances.
It is made of rather unique materials, and its craftsmanship is quite different from the designs that are currently in vogue. An unpredictable strength has been woven into the ethereal strings that can even allow it to cause the illusions within the heart of its player to surface.
There is an old adage in Liyue: "the longer one's eye of the flower drinks, the deeper one's heart into the mire sinks." It seems that only the strong-willed may use this instrument.

Name: Omni-Ubiquity Net
Desc: A net created using onmyoudou. It can be used to detain the essences of small animals and also serves as a medium to recreate their forms. There exists a training ground somewhere in Inazuma that uses onmyoudou to recreate monsters and villains. The technique used to make these nets may be the product of those same techniques following many long years of degradation in power and knowledge.

Name: Ayesha's Chaos Prospector
Desc: A handy tool that the researcher Ayesha created on the side while researching ancient relics. It can be used to detect such ancient relics buried underground. Due to its hasty production, however, its accuracy could stand to be improved. Users should beware that some unexpected things may occur while using this gadget...

Name: Peculiar Pinion
Desc:
After defeating the monster that made the apex of Amakumo Peak its home, you discovered this strange feather.
It fell from the Thunderbird that once inhabited Tsurumi Island, and is the original form of the Maushiro.
It may have some special properties on Tsurumi Island.

Name: Peculiar Pinion
Desc:
A feather left behind by the Thunderbird that once obliterated Tsurumi Island. It is filled with many memories and much power.
The people dwelling within the island fog worshiped the being whose light they could see even through the shroud all around them, and the feathers that fell from the Thunderbird also became the basis for the now-lost Tsurumi instrument, the Maushiro.
Due to a change, the Thunderbird would eventually annihilate all civilization on the island, and it would later itself be slain over Seirai Island.

Name: Mini Seelie: Viola
Desc:
A memento from the Lost Riches event. Equip it to obtain a mini Seelie companion.
A miniature purple Seelie. Its color is very similar to that of Electro-infused items. Who knows if you might get a little tingle from poking it...

Name: Treasure-Seeking Seelie
Desc:
A small and special Seelie, particularly sensitive to the presence of Iron Coins.
A companion entrusted to you by Ulman. Seelie are naturally inclined to guide people, though this Seelie seems weaker than usual, and possesses a remarkable obsession with Iron Coins...

Name: Memento Lens
Desc:
A mysterious lens that was once part of a special Kamera.
They say that in the distant past, the legendary Kitsune Saiguu left a catalyst for the then-Hiiragi Clan head, Hiroshi, as a tool to be used in exorcisms. The Hiiragis would have a special Kamera made to order from overseas with that catalyst mounted on its lens assembly, before giving it back to the Grand Narukami Shrine as a symbol of their friendship. That Kamera was said to have been able to record thoughts and memories, and though the complicated components may have rusted away over time, the specially-made lens can still see that which does not exist in the present world.

Name: Red Feather Fan
Desc:
This item possesses some sort of mysterious power. In the hands of the tengu warriors, it can have various effects, but in the hands of an ordinary person, it can still have enough power to "make one's body lighter" while in mid-air.
Legend has it that the first successor of the Iwakura Art had an agreement with a Yougou tengu warrior to have an annual duel. This being the time before the secret blade techniques of the Iwakura were created, his sword could not touch the tengu, who could use the power of free flight granted to its race. Rather than duels, these could be better described as pranking sessions, courtesy of the tengu.

Name: Electro Treasure Compass
Desc: A handy tool used to locate nearby chests and relevant clues. The land of the thundering archipelago has suffered a great many past hurts. The many treasure chests that dot the islands are a symbol of its revival from these wounds. Before the Sakoku Decree, countless travelers, merchants, adventurers and Treasure Hoarders walked this land. Now, the nation is under lockdown. Yet even the Sakoku's storms shall find it hard to stop those who desire treasure...

Name: Seed Dispensary
Desc:
A special container obtained from Madame Ping. According to her, this dispensary has the power to "generate seeds"... That is to say, it can create the seeds of various plants according to their special traits, which can then be planted within the appropriate fields within your Serenitea Pot.
Plants available for planting: Silk Flower, Sweet Flower, Cecilia, Glaze Lily, Windwheel Aster, Qingxin, Violetgrass, Valberry, Small Lamp Grass, Jueyun Chili, Carrot, Radish, Mint, Mushroom, Naku Weed, Horsetail, Snapdragon, Lotus Head, Calla Lily, Seagrass, Sea Ganoderma, Harra Fruit, Zaytun Peach, Sumeru Rose, Pluie Lotus, Marcotte, Lumidouce Bell, Rainbow Rose, Grainfruit, Cacahuatl, Saurian Claw Succulent, Quenepa Berry, Brilliant Chrysanthemum, Sprayfeather Gill, Glowing Hornshroom, Skysplit Gembloom.

Name: Electroculus Resonance Stone
Desc:
A stone that can be used in Inazuma to search for nearby Electroculi.
This strange device can resonate with Electro Statues of The Seven. Due to this trait, it can detect the presence of Electroculi.
Across the span of endless years, even the most majestic cities and sculptures would be worn down by wind and rain, and even the power of Statues of The Seven would gradually dissipate. But this faded strength would coalesce once more into the Oculi, which call out wordlessly to their Statues.

Name: Hot Pod
Desc: A Harpastum Bomb brimming with Pyro energy. When unleashed, it will burst into violent flame, dealing a small amount of Pyro DMG over a small AoE. It is extraordinarily effective against Cryo shields.

Name: Floaty Splody
Desc: A Harpastum Bomb of cunning design that sends fragments flying every which way when it explodes, dealing a certain amount of Pyro DMG over a wide AoE.

Name: Straight Shooter
Desc: A Harpastum Bomb with a comfortable weight that makes it easy to control and throw accurately. It can deal a large amount of Pyro DMG to a single opponent.

Name: Waverider Repair Toolbox
Desc:
A toolbox filled with all manner of items that can be used to repair the damage done to a Waverider.
For someone who is ever wandering such as yourself, your Waverider is like a "home," so take good care of it!

Name: Wind-Blessed Harpastum
Desc:
A harpastum made from pure bird feathers and strong fabric. It is the centerpiece of Ludi Harpastum, the traditional festival of Mondstadt.
Birds are creatures that ride the wind, and thus do their feathers also carry "blessings borne on the wind." As such, the people of Mondstadt believe that harpasta can not only bring the blessings of Barbatos but that they also contain a strange power...

Name: Serenitea Pot
Desc: A teapot obtained from Madame Ping. There seems to be a whole new realm within it...

Name: Windsong Lyre
Desc:
Use this traditional instrument from Mondstadt to play songs.
An instrument of incredible workmanship, it will surely produce moving music when played by able hands.
Mondstadt has a long-standing tradition of poetry and song, and thus also boasts a long history of constructing instruments to that effect. Bards are most proud of their songs and poems, and perhaps the instruments, too, would be proud of their owners and their musical tradition.

Name: Windblume Festival Commemorative Balloon
Desc:
Use this to release a balloon that can be popped.
Balloons have special significance in the land of the wind, for they represent the freedom to drift with the wind. Of course, air pressure will destroy balloons once they've reached a certain height.

Name: Endora
Desc: Just a very curious Lochfolk who only wishes to see the world. Might actually get along very well with Mini Seelie: Dayflower, but please do not meld them together, thank you.

Name: Inquisitive Endora
Desc:
A strange Lochfolk larva, filled with curiosity about the world at large.
Lochfolk specialize in shifting into watery shapes and can meld with other water bodies to synchronize emotions and knowledge alike. Endora is still small, and Endora is very curious. Endora can spit out bubbles to meld with other beings of water, through which she shall learn everything.

Name: Parametric Transformer
Desc:
A device that can transmute materials placed within and convert them into some other materials.
·During the transmutation process, you must use Elemental Attacks to generate enough energy for the transmutation to take place.
·After obtaining the transmuted materials, you must wait seven days to use the Parametric Transformer once again.

This mysterious device, discovered within the ruins, has the power to accelerate cycles and "transmute" material objects. Generally speaking, everything is undergoing a cycle. Memories and elements surge within the ley lines, rotten fallen fruits return to the soil, and the trees born from the soil will one day bear their crystalline fruit...

Name: Special Kamera
Desc:
When used, this useful gadget can save and store the scenery before it and add a special color tone to it.
A strange device from Fontaine that will not only record sceneries but will also add special colors to the printed images. This design was made in response to "The Steambird"'s request for a Kamera that could not only reflect the environment, but also the emotions of the one taking the picture. Unfortunately, the final product could not quite match their specifications.

Name: Kurious Kamera
Desc:
Use this during the "Five Flushes of Fortune" event to store images of objects with a specific color.
Ji Tong imported this new-fangled Kamera model from Fontaine, but it doesn't seem to work quite as he'd hoped...

Name: Kamera
Desc:
A convenient tool that records and saves images upon use.
A special item from Fontaine that can record images. People and places to remember must come aplenty for a Traveler roaming the world.

Name: Warming Bottle
Desc:
Upon use, emits heat for a short period over a small area, diminishing the effect of Sheer Cold.
Warming Seelie have evolved in response to the extreme change in temperature to give the comfort of warmth to those who seek it. This convenient gadget was originally crafted by those who struggled to survive in the snowy mountains in imitation of such evolved Seelie.

Name: Mini Seelie: Curcuma
Desc:
A memento from the Lost Riches event. Equip it to obtain a mini Seelie companion.
A miniature golden Seelie. It gives off a feeling very similar to that of Mora. They say that Seelie of this color represent good fortune.

Name: Mini Seelie: Rosé
Desc:
A memento from the Lost Riches event. Equip it to obtain a mini Seelie companion.
A miniature powder-pink Seelie. Though it cannot say a word, it will silently follow a traveler that strikes its fancy around the world.

Name: Mini Seelie: Dayflower
Desc:
A memento from the Lost Riches event. Equip it to obtain a mini Seelie companion.
A miniature sea-blue Seelie. Unlike other Seelie, it does not serve to guide others, but to follow them to see the world.

Name: Treasure-Seeking Seelie
Desc:
A small and special Seelie, particularly sensitive to the presence of Iron Coins.
A companion entrusted to you by Ulman. Seelie are naturally inclined to guide people, though this Seelie seems weaker than usual, and possesses a remarkable obsession with Iron Coins...

Name: Anemo Treasure Compass
Desc: A handy tool used to locate nearby chests and relevant clues. The needle of the Treasure Compass doesn't spin according to the world's magnetic field, but rather follows the energy of ley lines to lead the user to treasure. It is rumored that some adventurers are vehemently against the use of such tools, because of strongly held ideals such as "treasure hunting is about the journey, not the destination," and so on...

Name: NRE (Menu 30)
Desc: A handy meal-in-a-pouch that can transform most foods into instantly absorbable nutritional matter, this unique tool was designed by an alchemist attached to the Knights of Favonius. Despite the alchemist's insistence that it can greatly increase the efficiency of nutritional intake, most knights aren't too keen to put their food in it...

Name: Adepti Seeker's Stove
Desc:
A portable stove that can be quickly set up for cooking in the environment. If you enter into combat nearby, it will be destroyed.
Liyue's terrain is vast, varied, and at times even inhospitable — and yet all its inhabitants share a love of good food. These two phenomena would not be able to coexist were it not for portable cooking equipment like this. Whether you are scaling the heights of Jueyun Karst or exploring the islets of Guyun Stone Forest, bringing a portable stove means that a delicious and freshly cooked hot meal is always available at a moment's notice.

Name: Portable Waypoint
Desc:
Use this to create a temporary Teleport Waypoint at your current location. Only one can exist at a time.
A pocket-sized item that creates a temporary Teleport Waypoint. It is capable of connecting with the ley lines, at least to the extent necessary to bring about teleportation.
Although it offers an incredible convenience to Vision bearers, the actual principles behind Teleport Waypoints are not yet fully understood. We can only hope that using them does not cause any undesirable side effects...

Name: Wind Catcher
Desc:
A bottle that is able to hold Anemograna and use their energy to generate wind currents.
This item was designed by Knights of Favonius scholars to help the Knights on their scouting expeditions and travels by affording them the ability to better use the blessings of the Anemo God.
In order to take advantage of its wind currents with a wind glider, you technically need a gliding license — this has prevented it from becoming widely used, at least legally anyway.

Name: Geo Treasure Compass
Desc: A handy tool used to locate nearby chests and relevant clues. The land of Geo is rich with valuable resources, with treasures hidden throughout the mountains and wilderness just waiting to be found. Every Treasure Hoarder around dreams of getting their hands on a magical compass like this.

Name: Geoculus Resonance Stone
Desc:
A stone that can be used in Liyue to search for nearby Geoculi.
This exquisite stone plate imitates a certain mysterious quality of the Geo Statues of The Seven, causing it to lead people to the location of Geoculi.
Elemental Oculi represent the lost power of the Statues of The Seven — perhaps offering this power back to the statues also has significance for the lands that the gods watch over.

Name: Anemoculus Resonance Stone
Desc:
A stone that can be used in Mondstadt to search for nearby Anemoculi.
This man-made stone plate possesses a certain characteristic similar to that of the Anemo Statues of The Seven, giving it the power to resonate with Anemoculi.
Oculus Resonance Stones are crude imitations of the Statues of The Seven constructed by the ancients. But it is precisely this crudeness that makes them crave the power of elemental oculi, thus providing devout worshippers and adventurers alike a prime opportunity to collect oculi.
